0.title: This marks another year of your brilliance: Ajay on Rohit's birthday
0.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn took to Twitter and wished filmmaker Rohit Shetty on his birthday. "Our collaborations have always left me thrilled, ROFL-ing and pumped for more! This marks another year of your brilliance, hard work and creativity. Happy birthday, my friend," Ajay wrote. The duo has worked together in several projects like the 'Golmaal' series, 'Zameen' and 'Singham'.

1.title: Shah Rukh's old video on 'futility of war' goes viral amid Russia-Ukraine war
1.article_body: Amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine, an old video where Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan is talking about the "futility of war", has gone viral online. "Only the dead have seen the end of war. Nobody knows when a war's going to end. It only ends for the guys who've died...War isn't an alternative to peace, goodness," said Shah Rukh.

2.title: 'Musk-Putin's fight will be over in 10 secs' says Twitter user; Musk says 'pretty much'
2.article_body: Elon Musk responded "pretty much" to a Twitter user who claimed Musk and Russian President Vladimir Putin's "fight" would be over in 10 seconds. The user said, "It'd just depend on how much damage Elon would want to do (and) how fast. Nothing else...Elon is also 19 years younger." This comes after Musk challenged Putin to single combat for Ukraine.

3.title: Video captures moment when missile strikes & explodes in Ukraine street
3.article_body: CCTV footage captured the moment when a missile hit a street in Ukraine’s Kyiv. In the clip, a person can be seen walking along the street when a missile strikes through the air, smashes on the road leading to an explosion. The explosion reportedly destroyed a tram and hit part of a residential building.

4.title: I'm not in a rush to appear in B'wood films, I can wait: Pooja Hedge
4.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde in an interview said that she is not in a rush to appear in Bollywood films and doesn't fear losing out on visibility. "No, I can wait...It is a blessing that the audience has accepted me in every region," the actress added. Pooja further said that people earlier only complimented her screen presence and beauty.

5.title: Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis tests positive for COVID-19
5.article_body: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis on Monday said he tested positive for COVID-19 through a video message on Instagram. "I tested positive this morning and therefore will isolate at home and work from there," stated Mitsotakis. This comes after Mitsotakis held talks over the war in Ukraine with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan in Istanbul on Sunday.

6.title: Janhvi will be brilliant in 'Mili', can't wait to watch her: Anna
6.article_body: Malayalam actress Anna Ben said actress Janhvi Kapoor will be brilliant in the film 'Mili' and added she can't wait to watch her in it. 'Mili' is a Hindi remake of Anna's 2019 Malayalam film 'Helen'. "I'm...excited for Mili because Mathukutty (Xavier) has directed the film in Hindi as well," she stated. The film stars Manoj Pahwa and Sunny Kaushal.

7.title: How to lose elections can be learned from Congress: Anurag Thakur
7.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur while referring to Congress' defeat in the recently-concluded state Assembly elections said that "how to lose elections" should be learned from the party. He said, "There was no anti-incumbency in any of the states" adding that the clean image and good work of the Chief Ministers also led to their victory.

8.title: To me, it's all life: Russian influencer's crying video after Instagram ban goes viral
8.article_body: After Russia banned Instagram, a video of a crying Russian Instagram influencer is being widely shared on social media. In the clip, she said, "Do you think that for me, as an Instagram influencer, this is [a] source of income? To me, it’s [Instagram] just all life, it’s the soul. It’s the one with which I wake up, fall asleep."

9.title: Ukraine to launch NFT collection depicting the Russia-Ukraine war
9.article_body: The Ukrainian government will launch an NFT collection to depict the story of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Deputy Digital Transformation Minister Alexander Bornyakov said. The collection will be "like a museum of the Russia-Ukraine war". He added that each NFT art would represent a story from the war and would be backed with a reliable news source.

10.title: It shows where Pak cricket is at: Taylor on pitches in Pak-Aus Tests
10.article_body: Talking about the pitches used in Rawalpindi and Karachi for the first two Pakistan-Australia Tests, ex-Australia captain Mark Taylor said, "Unfortunately...it shows where Pakistan cricket is at." Taylor stated pitches used in Rawalpindi and Karachi are roads and added, "They are hard, you can see there's not much grass on them." He added he would've loved to see good pitches.

11.title: Feel good series win: Irfan on India's 2-0 series whitewash vs Sri Lanka
11.article_body: Following India's 2-0 series whitewash against Sri Lanka after winning the second Test by 238 runs in Bengaluru, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Feel good series win by Team India." He added, "Not a single win during this Indian trip for Sri Lanka, they need to learn a lot quickly." Earlier, India beat Sri Lanka 3-0 in three-match T20I series.

12.title: No plan to make it mandatory for airlines to play Indian music: Govt
12.article_body: Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh on Monday said that the government is not planning to make it mandatory for airlines and airports to play Indian music in their flights and terminal premises. On December 27, the Ministry of Civil Aviation had asked all airlines and airports to consider playing Indian music in their flights and terminals.

13.title: Wind power generation to rise nearly 70% by 2024 in Sweden: Govt
13.article_body: Swedish Energy Agency, a state-run body on Monday said wind power generation in Sweden is expected to rise by about 70% by 2024. As per the agency, wind power generation is expected to rise from 27.4 terawatt hours (TWh) in 2021 to 46.9 TWh in 2024. The report added hydropower and nuclear energy will remain the country's largest power sources.

14.title: Turkey's Erdogan, Germany's Scholz to hold talks over Ukraine today
14.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz will hold talks over the war in Ukraine in Ankara on Monday, said Erdogan's office. As per the statement by the presidency, the two nations will discuss bilateral ties and Turkey-EU relations. The talks come as both countries work towards a ceasefire between Russia and Ukraine.

15.title: Kim's boyfriend Pete Davidson to fly to space on Blue Origin's next flight
15.article_body: Comedian Pete Davidson, who's currently dating socialite Kim Kardashian, will fly to the edge of space on billionaire Jeff Bezos-led Blue Origin's upcoming spaceflight. The space tourism company's fourth human flight is scheduled for March 23 and will carry five other customers. In October last year, 'Star Trek' actor William Shatner flew to space aboard Blue Origin's New Shepard rocket.

16.title: Whenever I drank alcohol I'd down an entire bottle, that wasn't okay: Aamir
16.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said in an interview that he used to drink occasionally earlier, but doesn't anymore. He said, "I was never one of those who drank regularly...but whenever I did...drink, I would down the entire bottle. I felt that that was not okay." Khan added that not being under his own control "didn't sit well" with him.

17.title: Craze of game is very high: Bumrah on security breach by fans in 2nd Test
17.article_body: Reacting to fans breaching security to click pictures with Virat Kohli on Day 2 of India-Sri Lanka second Test at M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru, India Test vice-captain Jasprit Bumrah said, "That's something we don't control." He added, "Obviously, security concern is an issue...craze for the game is very high and...fans get emotional sometimes." Two fans clicked selfies with Kohli.

18.title: Bank frauds fell from ₹61,229 cr in FY17 to ₹648 cr in Apr-Dec 2021: Govt
18.article_body: Bank frauds recorded a sharp decline over the past five years to ₹648 crore in the first nine months of FY22, Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad said on Monday. They stood at ₹61,229 crore in FY17 and at ₹11,583 crore in FY21. According to Karad, improved detection and reporting along with comprehensive steps resulted in the decline.

19.title: Had sex with my mother's friend, she was divorced: Shivam Sharma
19.article_body: Actor-model Shivam Sharma, who is a contestant on reality show 'Lock Upp', has revealed that he used to have sex with his mother's friend during his college days. "It isn't dirty because she was a divorcee and I wanted to help with her sexual life," he added. Shivam said that it's called 'pyaar do, pyaar lo' (give love, take love).

20.title: Maggi, coffee, tea to get costlier as Nestlé, HUL hike prices: Report
20.article_body: Nestlé products like Maggi noodles, Nescafé coffee and Hindustan Unilever Ltd's (HUL) BRU coffee, Taj Mahal tea and Brooke Bond tea will get costlier as the two companies have increased the prices of some of their products, CNBC-TV18 reported on Monday. Maggi noodles are set to get costlier by 9-16%, it added. Taj Mahal tea prices were hiked by 3.7-5.8%.

21.title: I want to speak to, entertain maximum number of people: Ayushmann
21.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana has stated that as an artist, he wants to speak to and entertain the maximum number of people through his brand of cinema. "I like to pick subjects that unify people making movies a community watching experience," he added. Ayushmann further said that some of the best times he's had at movies have been with his family.

22.title: France lifts mask mandate, other COVID-19 curbs on unvaccinated
22.article_body: France lifted several of its COVID-19 restrictions, including the mask mandate for most settings, on Monday. Wearing masks is no longer required in schools, businesses and offices, but remains mandatory on public transportation and other healthcare facilities. Additionally, people do not need to present proof of vaccination to enter venues, including cinemas, sports arenas, restaurants and bars.

23.title: WWE legend Razor Ramon suffers 3 heart attacks, put on life support
23.article_body: WWE Hall of Famer Scott Hall, popularly known as Razor Ramon, has suffered three heart attacks after a blood clot went loose following his hip surgery last week. Ramon is currently on life support at the Wellstar Kennestone Hospital in Marietta, Georgia. Ramon was hospitalised a little over a week ago after he fell and broke his hip.

24.title: China building 6,000-bed hospital in 6 days as COVID-19 resurges
24.article_body: A 6,000-bed makeshift hospital is under construction in China's Jilin City to cope with a resurgence of COVID-19 as China battles its worst COVID-19 outbreak in two years. The 6,000-bed facility is expected to be completed within six days, reported Xinhua. Jilin province recorded over 1,000 new cases for the second day in a row, on Monday.

25.title: Half-day in T'gana schools from March 15 amid rising temperature
25.article_body: All schools in Telangana will have half-day for students from March 15 (Tuesday) amid rising temperatures in the state. As per an order issued by the Telangana Directorate of School Education, the schools will remain open from 8 am to 12.30 pm. However, special classes shall continue for Class 10 students preparing for the upcoming SSC public examination.

26.title: Took us 32 yrs & film to get to know truth: Yami on 'The Kashmir...'
26.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam, speaking about the film 'The Kashmir Files', has said, "Being married to a Kashmiri Pandit, I know first hand of the atrocities...this peace-loving community has gone through." "It took us 32 years and a film to get to know the truth," she added. Yami is married to filmmaker Aditya Dhar, who directed 'Uri: The Surgical Strike'.

27.title: Kapp's an inspiration for young players: SA's Luus after win vs Eng
27.article_body: Following a three-wicket win over England in the Women's ODI World Cup, South Africa captain Sune Luus called her teammate Marizanne Kapp an inspiration for young players. Kapp claimed a five-wicket haul in the match and restricted England to 235 runs. In reply, South Africa chased the target with four balls to spare. Kapp was adjudged Player of the Match.

28.title: Unfair to Pakistan bowlers: Inzamam on pitches being used in Pak-Aus Tests
28.article_body: Amid the criticism over the pitches being used in ongoing Pakistan-Australia Test series, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said he requests Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Ramiz Raja to work on the groundsmen and pitch curators. "Pakistan's bowlers are good and have won matches for their side which is why it is unfair to treat them like this," added Inzamam.

29.title: People run for cover as waterspout turns into tornado at US beach, videos surface
29.article_body: Videos have surfaced online that showed a waterspout turning into a tornado at a beach in Florida, US. One of the clips showed people on the beach screaming and running for cover as it hurled towards them. Authorities confirmed that the tornado had peak winds of around 65 mph. Reports said there was no loss of life due to it.

30.title: You expect chicken biryani in veg hotel? 'Radhe Shyam' director on criticism
30.article_body: 'Radhe Shyam' director Radha Krishna Kumar has responded to critics panning the film for its lack of action, saying, "You go to a vegetarian hotel expecting them to serve chicken biriyani?" He further said that it doesn't make any sense since he had always said that the film will be a love story. 'Radhe Shyam' stars Prabhas and Pooja Hegde.

31.title: Russian attack near Poland border aimed at creating panic: Polish PM
31.article_body: Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki has said that Russia's missile attack on a Ukrainian military base near Poland's border on Sunday was aimed at creating panic among civilians. "A missile attack just 20 km from our border shows how Russia operates," Morawiecki said at a joint conference with his Ukrainian and Lithuanian counterparts. Notably, Poland is a NATO member country.

32.title: It has always been part of sport: Murray on Osaka being heckled
32.article_body: Expressing his sympathy for Naomi Osaka after she was reduced to tears by a heckler during her second-round loss on Saturday night at Indian Wells Masters, Andy Murray said he "feels for Osaka". He added that heckling has always been part of the sport. The four-time Grand Slam champion was upset by a crowd member shouting "Naomi, you suck".

33.title: Scientists create material that could make lighter, stronger vehicles
33.article_body: US scientists have created a new lightweight, shock-absorbing material that could help make lighter but stronger helmets, automobiles and aerospace parts. Researchers used Liquid Crystal Elastomers (LCEs) to increase the material's ability to hold strikes. Team observed that the material withstands impact from objects weighing about 1.8 to 6.8 kilograms coming at speeds of about 35.4 kilometres.

34.title: Senior citizens, students & COVID-19 warriors honoured at Pune event
34.article_body: Senior citizens, girl students and female COVID-19 warriors were felicitated at an event organised by Kasarwadi Citizens Forum in Pune on Women's Day. An MBA student who donated plasma for COVID-19 patients, a driver's daughter who secured 92% marks in an exam and a nurse who survived COVID-19 after six months in intensive care were among those honoured.

35.title: Home interiors delivered in 45 days or we pay you rent: HomeLane
35.article_body: HomeLane, a home interior solutions brand has unveiled its "Guaranteed" campaign, aiming to communicate delivery of personalised home interiors within 45* days and with no hidden costs. The company states, in case of unsuccessful on-time delivery, HomeLane will pay rent for everyday of delay*. As a special offer, HomeLane is also giving flat 30% off* on woodwork till 25th March.

36.title: Gandhis alone not responsible for Cong's loss in 5 states: Kharge
36.article_body: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge has said that during the Congress Working Committee meeting on Sunday, party chief Sonia Gandhi was told that she alone isn't responsible for Congress' defeat in five states. "Every state leader and MP is responsible, not the Gandhi family," Kharge added. "We reposed our faith in her, there's no question of offering resignation," he said.

37.title: Wanted gangster involved in supplying illegal guns arrested in Delhi
37.article_body: A wanted gangster, who was involved in supplying illegal guns and other weapons in Delhi, was arrested in Civil Lines and police recovered four pistols and over 30 bullets. Deputy Commissioner of Police (special cell) Pramod Singh Kushwah said the accused was listed as one of the top 10 wanted criminals by Meerut Police since February 2021.

38.title: Class 10 girl stabbed 4 times by 21-yr-old at school farewell in Pune
38.article_body: A class 10 student was allegedly stabbed at least four times by a 21-year-old at her school farewell in Pune on Monday, officials said. "He has stabbed her in the back, in the stomach, and cut the vein in her hand," said Imran Shaikh, a friend of the child's father. He escaped with another person on a two-wheeler, he added.

39.title: 3 women among 4 arrested for kidnapping 45-day-old infant in Delhi
39.article_body: Delhi Police on Saturday arrested four people, including three women, for allegedly kidnapping a 45-day-old infant girl from a shanty in Delhi's Punjabi Bagh, police said on Sunday. The woman "dragged" her neighbour, Bhawna, to the police station, alleging that she and her accomplices kidnapped her daughter, said a senior police officer. Police rescued the infant within a few hours.

40.title: Man tries to kill friend by handing him bag of explosives in Noida
40.article_body: Police arrested a 25-year-old man, who allegedly tried to kill his friend by handing him a bag of homemade explosives at a local market in Noida sector 63. The accused, identified as Ram Subek, started learning how to make explosives to take revenge after the victim, who lived with him, took a job from which he was fired.

41.title: Under-construction building collapses near Delhi's Kashmere Gate
41.article_body: A multi-storey under-construction building collapsed at Nicholson Road near Delhi's Kashmere Gate on Monday. According to the Delhi Fire Service, several people are feared trapped under the building rubble. "So far, eight persons have been rescued. All were workers on the site," said DCP (North) Sagar Kalsi.

42.title: After World Championships, Lovlina and Nikhat secure Asian Games selection
42.article_body: Olympic bronze-medallist Lovlina Borgohain and former junior world champion Nikhat Zareen on Monday were selected in the Indian women's boxing squad for 2022 Asian Games after winning their selection trial finals in 69kg and 51kg weight division respectively. Nikhat and Lovlina also qualified for World Championships in 52kg and 70kg categories respectively. Asian Games will begin on September 10.

43.title: Australia to replace suspended Russia in Billie Jean King Cup Finals
43.article_body: Australia will replace the suspended Russian contingent in the Billie Jean King Cup Finals, International Tennis Federation (ITF) said. Australia were the highest-ranked side among the losing semi-finalists last year and will now feature in the Finals in November. Russia were banned from defending their Billie Jean King Cup title following their invasion of Ukraine.

44.title: 7-time Super Bowl champ Brady comes back from retirement 6 weeks after quitting
44.article_body: Seven-time Super Bowl champion Tom Brady has decided to come out of retirement, six weeks after initially retiring from the sport. He will now feature for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in his 23rd NFL season. "These past two months I've realised my place is still on the field and not in the stands," the 44-year-old tweeted.

45.title: Man arrested by Mumbai Police in cheating case dies in hospital
45.article_body: Amol Sonawane, a 38-year-old man arrested in a cheating case by Mumbai's Pant Nagar Police on Thursday, died in hospital on Sunday after falling ill. A senior officer said that Sonawane was found fit in a medical test that was done before his arrest. He added Sonawane was taken to hospital on Thursday before being admitted on Saturday.

46.title: Afghan embassy in Washington DC to close down this week: US
46.article_body: US state department official on Saturday confirmed the cash-strapped Afghanistan's embassy in the country will shut down this week. The official added the diplomats are now left with a month to apply for residency in the US before being deported. This comes less than six months after US pulled out of Afghanistan as Taliban took over the country.

47.title: Knew it was going to be drawn Test: Wasim Akram on 1st Pak-Aus Test
47.article_body: Wasim Akram said he tried watching the two Test matches between Pakistan and Australia, but couldn't. "As an ex-fast bowler I knew this would be a draw match after the second delivery of the match," Akram said about the Rawalpindi Test. "If you want to make slow pitches at least make it a turner so...we get...result-oriented match," he stated.

48.title: Always with you: Suarez to Messi, Neymar on being booed by PSG fans
48.article_body: Atletico Madrid forward Luis Suarez has supported his former Barcelona teammates Lionel Messi and Neymar Jr, who were recently booed by the PSG fans following the French club's Champions League exit. Taking to Instagram Stories, Suarez posted a picture with Messi and Neymar and wrote, "As always, football has no memories. Always with you. I love you very much."

49.title: Common man can flourish: Sanitation worker who won on BJP ticket in UP
49.article_body: Ganesh Chandra Chauhan, a sanitation worker who contested on BJP's ticket in UP Assembly elections from Dhanghata constituency, said that his win has proved that a common man can also flourish. Chauhan said that the state has reformed under BJP's governance, adding that UP residents have "rejected dynasty politics and casteism". Chauhan defeated SBSP's Alagu Prasad by 10,553 votes.

50.title: Do you agree to this fight?: Musk to Putin after challenging him to single combat
50.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday in a tweet tagged the President of Russia's official Twitter account and asked, "Do you agree to this fight?" In an earlier tweet, Musk had said, "I hereby challenge Vladimir Putin to single combat...Stakes are Ukraine." When a Twitter user asked, "Did you think this through?", Musk responded, "I am absolutely serious."

51.title: 32-yr-old man sexually assaults 4-yr-old girl in Pune, arrested
51.article_body: A 32-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a four-year-old girl in the Khed area in Maharashtra's Pune district. The accused allegedly asked the girl to accompany him to his room and assaulted her on Friday and Saturday, police said. The matter was reported to the police by the girl's mother.

52.title: Govt hasn't agreed to set up regulator for crypto investments: MoS Finance
52.article_body: The government has not agreed to set up a regulatory authority for investments in cryptocurrencies, the Minister of State for Finance, Pankaj Chaudhary, informed the Lok Sabha on Monday. On being asked about policies regarding misleading crypto ads, he replied that the government and the RBI have been cautioning investors about potential economic, financial, legal, and security related risks.

53.title: Have no server outside India: CEO denies report of Paytm Payments Bank data leak
53.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma dismissed a report that claimed RBI barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers over data leak to Chinese entities. He said, "Absolutely false...The RBI in its letter didn't raise concern over any leak of data...We have no server that is outside India, and no foreign national has any access to our servers."

54.title: China slams 4 firms for falsifying carbon data, forging test reports
54.article_body: China's Ministry of Ecology and Environment (MEE) charged four data verification firms with tampering and forging test reports, making false coal samples and writing distorted, inaccurate conclusions. The move is a part of a campaign by MEE that aims to determine the accuracy of carbon emission verification reports submitted across China. The campaign was launched in October-December last year.

55.title: LIC IPO likely to be launched in mid-May: Reports
55.article_body: LIC's IPO may be postponed to mid-May amid rising market volatility due to the Russia-Ukraine war, Moneycontrol reported. India NSE Volatility Index was at about 26 in Mumbai on Monday, 11 points above the required 15 to launch the IPO. If the IPO is not launched before May 12, a new IPO prospectus will have to be filed by LIC.

56.title: Shraddha becomes second most-followed Indian actress on Instagram
56.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor has become the second-most followed Indian actress on Instagram with over 70 million followers. She is preceded by actress Priyanka Chopra who has 75.1 million followers on the social media platform. Shraddha made her Bollywood debut in 2010 film 'Teen Patti'. She will next be seen in Luv Ranjan's untitled romantic-comedy film along with actor Ranbir Kapoor.

57.title: 3,000 kg smuggled gold seized by Delhi Customs in last 11 years
57.article_body: Delhi's customs department has seized nearly 3,000 kg gold worth around ₹1,535 crore in 2,522 cases of smuggling in the last 11 years, according to an RTI reply. As many as 1,632 people, including 324 foreigners, were arrested in these cases. The highest amount of gold was seized in 2014-15 at 574 kg, followed by 505 kg seized in 2015-16.

58.title: I-T dept conducts searches at real estate group Omaxe's premises
58.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Monday conducted searches at premises of real estate group Omaxe. At least 30 locations in Delhi-NCR and few others in Uttar Pradesh and Punjab are being searched on charges of tax evasion, officials said. Searches conducted by the department are linked to alleged irregularities and concealment of income by the company.

59.title: B'luru man returning home with food for mother rides into pothole, dies
59.article_body: A 27-year-old man died on Monday after his bike hit a pothole and he fell on the road in Bengaluru. The incident took place when he was returning home after getting food packed for his mother from a hotel on Sunday late night. The victim worked at a private firm and he was the only earning member in his family.

60.title: Rachakonda Police bust ₹10-crore railway job scam, 2 arrested
60.article_body: Rachakonda Police have busted a railway job scam, which allegedly defrauded more than 100 job aspirants of over ₹10 crore and also arrested two accused, it said on Monday. The accused had allegedly assured aspirants of jobs in the railways without having to appear for examinations. Police also seized ₹9 lakh cash, two cars and fraudulent documents from the accused.

61.title: Retail inflation rises to 8-month-high of 6.07% in February 2022
61.article_body: India's retail inflation rose to an eight-month-high of 6.07% in February 2022, government data showed on Monday. This is the second successive month that retail inflation has breached the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) upper margin of 6%. The retail inflation, measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), stood at 6.01% for the month of January in 2022.

62.title: Ganga river water is fit for bathing: Centre
62.article_body: The dissolved oxygen level of river Ganga is within acceptable limits of the bathing criteria, the Centre said on Monday. The dissolved oxygen level is a measure to assess the health of the water body. None of the Ganga stretches is in priority category I-IV (most polluted categories) while two stretches are in category V (least polluted category).

63.title: Iranian Foreign Minister to visit Russia on March 15: Govt
63.article_body: Spokesperson for Iranian Foreign Ministry on Monday said Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian is slated to visit Russia on Tuesday, March 15. The minister will visit the country as nuclear talks between Iran, Western powers face the prospect of collapse. This comes after Russia demanded guarantees that Iran-Russia trade would not be affected by   sanctions on Moscow over Ukrainian invasion.

64.title: India win record-extending 15th straight Test series at home, whitewash Sri Lanka 2-0
64.article_body: India defeated Sri Lanka by 238 runs in three days in the Day-Night Test in Bengaluru to complete a 2-0 series whitewash. India have now extended their record for winning most consecutive Test series at home with 15 straight series victories. Notably, India have lost just one of their last 30 Test series on home soil.

65.title: Russia offering oil at heavy discount, India looking to buy it: Report
65.article_body: India is considering taking up a Russian offer to buy its crude oil and other commodities at discounted prices, Reuters reported. India, which imports 80% of its oil needs, usually buys about 2% to 3% of its supplies from Russia. "Russia is offering oil and other commodities at a heavy discount. We'll be happy to take that," an official said.

66.title: I hereby challenge Putin to single combat, stakes are Ukraine: Elon Musk
66.article_body:
World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "I hereby challenge Vladimir Putin
to single combat...Stakes are Ukraine." When a Twitter user asked, "Will you be surprised when he (Russian President Putin) accepts your challenge?", Musk responded, "That would be an honour." Musk's tweet garnered users' reactions like, "Go to bed Elon," and "I need some of what you're drinking."

67.title: Employees of Pune's Hinjewadi IT park being asked to return to offices
67.article_body: Over two lakh IT companies' employees in Pune's Hinjewadi software park, who have been working from home for last two years, are gradually being asked to return to offices as COVID-19 cases decline. Pavanjit Mane of Forum of IT Employees said some companies have circulated forms asking employees' views. Earlier, the companies conducted special camps to get their employees vaccinated.

68.title: Man beats wife, tries to kill brother for protecting her in Gurugram
68.article_body: Police have booked a man for allegedly trying to kill his brother twice on Saturday after he saved his sister-in-law from getting assaulted by him in Gurugram, officials said on Sunday. Police said that the accused allegedly stabbed his brother with a knife on Saturday and escaped. However, he returned later with a pistol and opened fire at his brother.

69.title: Tata Sons chief N Chandrasekaran appointed as Air India chairman
69.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran was appointed as the chairman of Air India on Monday. His appointment comes a month after he was given a five-year extension in his term as Tata Sons’ Executive Chairman. Meanwhile, Air India is currently looking for a new CEO after the former Chairman of Turkish Airlines Ilker Ayci declined to be Air India's CEO.

70.title: 14 trapped for 90 minutes as lift stucks at Chennai railway station
70.article_body: As many as 14 people, including a toddler, were trapped inside an elevator at the Nungambakkam railway station in Chennai after it stuck for around 90 minutes on Sunday night. Officials removed the fan inside the elevator and lifted up the people through a hole. An official said overloading may have caused the elevator to malfunction.

71.title: Mumbai Police band plays 'Srivalli' song from 'Pushpa: The Rise'
71.article_body: The Mumbai Police's band, Khaki Studio, on Monday released their rendition of the song 'Srivalli' from the movie 'Pushpa: The Rise'. Sharing the video, the force tweeted, "#KhakiStudio rukhega nahi! We noticed Mumbaikars swaying to the tunes of 'Srivalli' and decided to join in!". The band had previously played songs like the James Bond theme and Bella Ciao.

72.title: SP won 304 seats in ballot paper counting: SP Maurya alleges foul play
72.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader SP Maurya on Monday said his party "won on 304 seats in the ballot paper counting while BJP won on just 99 seats". He alleged that when counting was done from EVM, BJP won. "This means there is some foul play," he said. Former UP minister Maurya joined SP on January 14 after leaving BJP.

73.title: He always wants to get better than yesterday: Gavaskar on Bumrah
73.article_body: Calling Jasprit Bumrah a "successful bowler" following his eighth five-wicket Test haul in Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the India pacer always wants to get better than yesterday. "The skillset and variety he has no batsman can feel at ease. He has got this ability to get...batsman out when the batter is set," he stated.

74.title: Kiran gave list of my weaknesses, drawbacks: Aamir on best b'day gift
74.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has revealed that the best birthday gift of his life was the list of his weaknesses and drawbacks made by his ex-wife Kiran Rao. "She gave me a list of 10 to 12 points that I sat and wrote as well," the actor added. Aamir further said that she pointed it all out with honesty and love.

75.title: COVID-19 positivity rate dips to 3.3% in Pune, nobody on ventilator
75.article_body: The daily COVID-19 positivity rate in Pune has dropped to 3.34% and the city currently has no patient on ventilator support, while only one patient is on oxygen support in a hospital, health officials said. "Only 14 of the 574 active COVID-19 patients are currently in hospital, which is just 2.43%," said a civic health officer.

76.title: Prabhas' 'Radhe Shyam' earns ₹151 crore worldwide in 3 days
76.article_body: Prabhas and Pooja Hegde-starrer 'Radhe Shyam' has grossed ₹151 crore at the worldwide box office within three days of its release. UV Creations, the production house behind the period romantic drama, shared the news on Monday, writing on Twitter, "A phenomenal response for #RadheShyam with ₹151 crore gross in three days worldwide. #BlockBusterRadheShyam."

77.title: Misplaced pass, 'savage' Go First employee said 'Catch next flight': Babil
77.article_body: Actor Babil took to Instagram Stories to share that he was told to "go catch the next flight" by a Go First, formerly known as GoAir, employee after the actor told him that he had misplaced his boarding pass. "I know GoAir has rude staff reputation but...that is not rude that is savage," Babil wrote.

78.title: 3.5 million children in Afghanistan need nutritious treatment: WFP
78.article_body: United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) has said that 3.5 million children in Afghanistan currently need nutritious treatment. UNICEF had earlier said that half of the Afghan children aged below five will be exposed to acute malnutrition in 2022. Afghanistan has been experiencing food shortages amid an economic crisis triggered after the Taliban seized power in the country last year.

79.title: Ravichandran Ashwin becomes 8th highest wicket-taker in Test cricket history
79.article_body: Team India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has become the eighth-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket history. After dismissing Dhananjaya de Silva in Sri Lanka's second innings in the Day-Night Test, Ashwin took his tally of Test wickets to 440, overtaking Dale Steyn's tally of 439 wickets. Ex-West Indies pacer Courtney Walsh is the seventh-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket with 519 scalps.

80.title: What is the Mumbai Climate Action Plan all about?
80.article_body: The Mumbai Climate Action Plan announced by the Maharashtra government on Sunday aims towards zero emission of greenhouse gas or a net-zero target for 2050. Mumbai's target puts it two decades ahead of India's national goal of cutting its emissions to net-zero by 2070. It proposes large-scale changes on priority across six strategic areas.

81.title: Hindi remake of Tamil action thriller 'Aaranya Kaandam' in the works
81.article_body: Producers Ramesh Taurani and Akshai Puri have acquired rights to the Tamil neo-noir action thriller 'Aaranya Kaandam'. It will be directed by Ajay Bahl, who has helmed films like 'Section 375' and 'B.A. Pass'. The film follows a day in the lives of six characters, played by Jackie Shroff, Ravi Krishna, Sampath Raj, Yasmin Ponnappa, Guru Somasundaram and Master Vasanth.

82.title: Fifty vs Pak was easy, but century vs WI came at risky situation: Mandhana
82.article_body: Talking about her performance in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup, India Women opener Smriti Mandhana said her century against WI is a special one as it came when team was in a "risky situation". "The first one [52-run knock against Pakistan] was achieved in easy circumstances," she added. In India's three matches, Mandhana has scored 52, 6, 123 runs.

83.title: Make 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free in Rajasthan: Cong MLA
83.article_body: Rajasthan Congress MLA Bhanwar Lal Sharma has urged the Congress-led state government to make 'The Kashmir Files' a tax-free movie in the state. Sharma added that he "will write a letter to CM Ashok Gehlot" for the same. The movie has already been made tax-free by the governments of Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh and Haryana.

84.title: Putin is frustrated with progress of Russian forces in Ukraine: US
84.article_body: US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin is frustrated that his forces are not making the kind of progress that he thought they would make in Ukraine, including in Kyiv. Sullivan added that for this reason, Putin is expanding the number of targets and trying to cause damage in every part of the country.

85.title: PM greeted with 'Modi, Modi' chants in Parliament after state poll wins
85.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was greeted by 'Modi, Modi' chants as he entered the Parliament to attend the second half of the Budget session as it resumed today. BJP MPs and Union Ministers were seen chanting PM's name and thumping the desks as the latter took his seat in the Lok Sabha. BJP emerged victorious in UP, Uttarakhand, Manipur and Goa.

86.title: Completely false: Paytm Payments Bank on report of leaking data to Chinese firms
86.article_body: Paytm Payments Bank denied a report that claimed that it was punished by the RBI for allegedly sharing information with China-based entities that indirectly own a stake in Paytm Payments Bank. "The report is completely false and simply sensationalising," the company said. Notably, China's Alibaba Group Holding and its affiliate, Jack Ma's Ant Group, own shares of Paytm.

87.title: Medical supplies continue to reach war-torn Ukraine: WHO
87.article_body: The WHO has said that the medical supplies including trauma kits, oxygen generators and drugs continue to reach Ukraine, which is under attack by Russian forces. "The coming days and weeks will see a constant flow of medical supplies," it said. It admitted that supply chains have been disrupted and that hospitals are struggling to cater to the patients.

88.title: His frustration is being seen on ground: Irfan on lack of runs from Kohli
88.article_body: Irfan Pathan has said Virat Kohli's frustration due to lack of runs from him is being seen on the ground. "Mistakes we are seeing from Kohli, we didn't use to see them earlier," he added. Following Kohli's 23 and 13 in ongoing second Test against Sri Lanka, his average slipped below fifty in Test cricket for first time since 2017.

89.title: Portion of balcony collapses in Delhi's Anand Parbat area, 4 injured
89.article_body: As many as four people were injured after a portion of their balcony collapsed in Delhi. The incident took place in the Anand Parbat area of the national capital on Sunday night. Reports said that officials of the Delhi Fire Service rushed to the spot and gave details about the incident.

90.title: My Ferrari can't go through: UK singer as he fills potholes near his house
90.article_body: Britain's 77-year-old singer Rod Stewart filled potholes on a road near his house in Harlow, Essex. In an Instagram video that showed him filling potholes, Stewart said, "People are bashing their cars up. The other day, there was an ambulance with a burst tyre. My Ferrari can't go through here at all." He added, "It's been like this for ages."

91.title: Indian Army constructs 2 houses within 4 weeks using 3D printing technology in Guj
91.article_body: The Indian Army's Military Engineering Services has constructed two houses in South Western Air Command in Gujarat's Gandhinagar within four weeks using 3D rapid construction technology, an official release said. Officials claim the houses are first-of-its-kind structures in India. Each house has a built area of around 700 square feet and is in compliance with Zone-3 earthquake specifications.

92.title: Andrea Bocelli's son to team up with Sukriti & Prakriti for a song: Report
92.article_body: Italian opera singer Andrea Bocelli's son Matteo is set to collaborate with singers, Prakriti Kakar and Sukriti Kakar, for a song, according to a report. "The single will be a classic east meets west collaborative effort and will embrace a lot of futuristic and experimental fusion soundscapes," a source told Pinkvilla. Matteo is expected to arrive in India this month.

93.title: Big B ensured we rehearsed thrice even for 1-2 lines: Maha official on 'Jhund'
93.article_body: Maharashtra state surveillance officer Dr Pradeep Awate, who shared screen space with actor Amitabh Bachchan in 'Jhund' said that Amitabh would ensure that rehearsals for a scene happened at least thrice even if it was one or two lines. "Despite his stature and experience as an actor, Amitabhji took the effort to ensure a perfect shot," Dr Awate said.

94.title: I am pretty surprised to see where he was standing: Karthik on Kohli's dismissal
94.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli getting LBW out for 13 runs in the second innings of the Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka, Dinesh Karthik said, "I am pretty surprised to see where he was standing in the crease." Karthik added, "He was standing much outside leg stump." Karthik further suggested that Kohli should have been standing on middle and leg stump.

95.title: Bengaluru man sues restaurant for 40 paise overcharge, fined ₹4,000
95.article_body: A consumer court ordered a Bengaluru senior citizen to pay ₹4,000 in compensation to a restaurant, Hotel Empire, after the former filed a lawsuit alleging that the restaurant had overcharged him by 40 paise. The judges ordered the petitioner, Murthy, to pay the compensation to the restaurant and stated that Murthy was "wasting the court's time for publicity".

96.title: Billionaire Founder of S Korean internet firm Kakao quits board
96.article_body: Brian Kim, the billionaire Founder of South Korea's leading chat app operator Kakao, has stepped down from the company's board. The development comes after reports claimed police were probing allegations that Kim evaded nearly $740 million taxes in 2014. Recently, the company was also criticised over sale of stock by top executives after a Kakao unit's successful stock market debut.

97.title: Nadal favourite to potentially win the Roland Garros 2022: Murray
97.article_body: British tennis player Andy Murray said that Rafael Nadal is the favourite to potentially win the Roland Garros 2022. Murray added Nadal has less pressure than the last couple of French Opens due to his good start to the year. In the ongoing season, Nadal has won three titles, including the Australian Open 2022, and is 16-0.

98.title: CBSE forms panel after complaints of wrong answer key in Class 10 Odia exam
98.article_body: CBSE has decided to constitute an expert committee after it received complaints from a school that the answer key of the Odia Language paper in the Term-1 Class 10 board exams was fractionally "wrong". CBSE further said, "An appropriate decision will be taken by the Board within 24 hours, on the basis of the report of the expert committee."

99.title: Pant is best wicketkeeper in terms of having impact on game: Parthiv
99.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said Rishabh Pant has consistently improved his wicketkeeping. He added Pant is among the top three Indian wicketkeepers in terms of batting ability. "If it's about having...impact on...game, then Pant is currently the best wicketkeeper," Parthiv stated. Pant scored the fastest fifty by an Indian in Test cricket in the Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka.

100.title: SP ally RLD dissolves all its units, frontals in Uttar Pradesh
100.article_body: Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) announced to "dissolve" its units (state, regional and district) and frontals in Uttar Pradesh "with immediate effect" on Monday. The party said that the directions for this order have been given by its national president Jayant Chaudhary. RLD contested the recent UP state Assembly elections in an alliance with the Akhilesh Yadav-led Samajwadi Party.

101.title: Chennai Metro opens 2 new stations in phase-1 extension stretch
101.article_body: Chennai Metro Rail Limited (CMRL) opened the Tiruvottiyur Theradi and Wimco Nagar Depot stations in phase-1 extension between Washermanpet and Wimco Nagar on Sunday. Commuters will also be able to park their vehicles at Wimco Nagar metro station free of charge till March 31, CMRL said. Phase-1 metro line consists of two corridors, Washermanpet-Chennai Airport and Chennai Central-St Thomas Mount.

102.title: Was ragged in school, was told 'Your dad wears sunglasses at night': Bappi's son
102.article_body: Late musician Bappi Lahiri's son Bappa Lahiri in an interview revealed that he used to get ragged in school because of his father's sunglasses. "People said, 'Oh, your father wears sunglasses at night, he can't see etc'," he added. "Today it's become like a trend. He never went by the book when it came to style," Bappa further said.

103.title: Meta prohibits calls for death of a head of state amid Russia-Ukraine war
103.article_body: Meta clarified on Sunday that it's not allowing posts calling for the death of a head of state in context of Russian invasion of Ukraine, Reuters reported citing President of Global Affairs Nick Clegg. This comes after Meta allowed some posts seeking the death of Russian President Vladimir Putin. "We are not condoning violence against Russians in general," Clegg wrote.

104.title: Clash between SP and BJP supporters leads to stone-pelting in UP; 10 booked
104.article_body: A political argument between supporters of Samajwadi Party and BJP led to a clash and stone-pelting in Uttar Pradesh, police said. According to police, an FIR was registered against 10 persons and three of them were detained in this connection. "Four police teams were rushed to the spot to contain the situation. Those involved...managed to escape," a police officer said.

105.title: Take responsibility for Uttarakhand defeat, apologised to members: Harish
105.article_body: Congress leader and former Uttarakhand Chief Minister Harish Rawat said that he takes responsibility for Congress' defeat in the Uttarakhand Assembly elections. "All of us thought that we were winning in Uttarakhand...I apologised to every member and leadership in the working committee. I have also apologised to the public before," Rawat said.

106.title: British Academy Film Awards pay tribute to Lata Mangeshkar in 'In Memoriam'
106.article_body: The late singer Lata Mangeshkar was featured in the 'In Memoriam' segment at the 2022 edition of the British Academy of Film and Television Awards. The tribute described her as "an Indian playback singer, who recorded an estimated 25,000 songs for more than 1,000 Hindi films over a career spanning 70 years". She passed away aged 92 on February 6.

107.title: Cong leaders don't have courage to make party Gandhi-mukt: BJP MP
107.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Modi has taken a dig at the Congress by saying that "Congress leaders don't have the courage to make their party Gandhi-mukt". "Drowned in corruption and dynastic politics, Congress has been pretending to brainstorm for the past many years," Modi said in a reference to Congress' defeat in the recent five state Assembly elections.

108.title: Sensex ends 935 points higher at 56,486, Nifty settles at 16,871
108.article_body: The Sensex on Monday climbed 935 points or 1.68% to settle at 56,486, while Nifty 50 jumped 241 points or 1.45% higher to close at 16,871. While Infosys was the top Nifty gainer as it rose close to 4%, Paytm shares fell more than 12% to hit an all-time low of ₹672 on the BSE on Monday.

109.title: Not a VIP, won't be given special facilities in jail: Court denies home food for Chitra
109.article_body: A Delhi court remarked that former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna is "not a VIP" and won't be provided special facilities during her 14-day judicial custody. Denying her home-cooked food, it said, "There are inmates who are in their 70s, who eat Tihar jail food. I have myself eaten Tihar...food. It’s good...VIP prisoners want everything...Every accused, every prisoner is the same."

110.title: 2 dead after shell hits residential building in Ukraine: Official
110.article_body: At least two people have died and three were hospitalised after a shell hit a nine-storey residential building in Ukraine's Kyiv on Monday, Internal Affairs adviser Anton Gerashchenko said. The fire was extinguished at 7.58 am, emergency services said. This comes as Ukraine's Deputy PM announced that they'll try to evacuate trapped civilians through 10 humanitarian corridors the same day.

111.title: Excited to get started with MI, looks very close-knit team: Archer
111.article_body: England pacer Jofra Archer, who was bought by MI for ₹8 crore in the IPL mega auction, has said he's really excited to get started with the franchise. "MI looks very close-knit and family-oriented and such teams always do well," he stated. Archer is likely to miss the upcoming season and feature for the franchise in IPL 2023.

112.title: 15-year-old girl gang-raped near Ahmedabad, 8 men arrested
112.article_body: Eight men were arrested on Sunday for allegedly abducting and raping a 15-year-old girl on the outskirts of Ahmedabad. According to police, the girl was brought to a secluded area by the main accused, where he had also called seven of his friends. She was then taken near a boring well where the eight men forced themselves upon her.

113.title: NASA shares pic of infant star's energetic outburst, says 'A star is born'
113.article_body: NASA has shared the picture of an energetic outburst from an infant star captured by the Hubble Space Telescope. Sharing the picture on Twitter, NASA tweeted, "A star is born." NASA explained, "This stellar tantrum, produced by an extremely young star in the earliest phase of formation, consists of an incandescent jet of gas travelling at supersonic speeds."

114.title: Singer Kanika Kapoor to get married second time in May: Report
114.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor, known for her song 'Baby Doll', will be getting married to NRI businessman Gautam in May, reported ETimes. This will be the singer's second marriage. She was earlier married to NRI businessman Raj Chandok and got divorced in 2012. Kanika and Gautam have reportedly been dating for a year and their wedding will take place in London.

115.title: No COVID-19 death reported in Navi Mumbai in March so far
115.article_body: No COVID-19 death was reported in the Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) in March so far. The civic body saw death due to COVID-19 last time on February 26. The city has so far reported 2,049 COVID-19 deaths, of which around 75 deaths were reported during the third wave of the pandemic.

116.title: Pant and Dhoni will stand out as India's greatest wicketkeepers: Karthik
116.article_body: Dinesh Karthik has said Rishabh Pant is on his way to greatness after the India wicketkeeper-batter  broke Kapil Dev's 40-year-old record (30-ball 50) to become the fastest half-centurion (28-ball 50) for India in Tests. He added that if Pant has a full-fledged wicketkeeping career then he and Dhoni will stand out as India's greatest wicketkeepers to have played the game.

117.title: AAP has enough experience to run Punjab govt: Bhagwant Mann
117.article_body: Punjab CM-designate Bhagwant Mann on Monday said AAP has enough experience to run the Punjab government. "We know how to run the administration. I have been a member of [Lok Sabha] for seven years," Mann said. He added, "Many veteran politicians have lost the elections and new people have won...There'll be out of the box thinking in this government."

118.title: KTR inaugurates data sciences company Gramener's new office in Hyd
118.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday inaugurated the new office of data sciences company Gramener in Hyderabad. The New Jersey-based company's Hyderabad office will have the capacity to aid enterprises with over 250 data science resources, the Telangana government has said. "Data sciences...is hugely underrated [right now] in a country like India," KTR said at the ceremony.

119.title: India improves in Maternal Mortality Ratio, on track to achieve 2030 goal: Govt
119.article_body: India made a significant improvement in Maternal Mortality Ratio as the number of deaths per lakh childbirths declined from 113 in 2016-18 to 103 in 2017-19, said the government. The country is on track to achieve the National Health Policy (NHP) target of 100/lakh live births by 2020 and the SDG target of 70/lakh live births by 2030, it added.

120.title: BJP lied about support to displaced Kashmiri Pandit families: Kerala Cong
120.article_body: Kerala Congress said BJP lied about government support to displaced [Kashmiri] Pandit families & claimed credit for Congress government's initiatives. "UPA government gave jobs to 15,000 Pandits, recruited 6,000 Pandits in J&K government," party's tweet read. "Pandits' migration started...in January 1990. BJP did nothing and continued supporting VP Singh till November 1990," another tweet said.

121.title: Actress Rebel Wilson flashes middle finger at Putin during BAFTA Awards
121.article_body: Australian actress Rebel Wilson flashed her middle finger at Russian President Vladimir Putin amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine while hosting the BAFTA Film Awards 2022. "This is the gesture for Putin," the 42-year-old actress said, flipping her middle finger as she spoke. BAFTA's Twitter handle shared her video and tweeted, "Here's a lesson in sign language from Rebel Wilson."

122.title: Gang of robbers arrested after gunfight in Delhi's Seemapuri
122.article_body: A gang of robbers was arrested by Delhi Police on Saturday following a gunfight in Delhi's Seemapuri area. Police confiscated two stolen bicycles, one pistol, three revolvers, 37 live ammunition, pepper spray and hammers from the gang. Two of the four accused were shot after police received a tip-off and laid a trap to nab them.

123.title: Vicky wins Performance of Year, Akshay wins Person of Year at Hello Hall of Fame Awards
123.article_body: Vicky Kaushal was awarded for Performance of the Year and Akshay Kumar was named Person of the Year at the HELLO! Hall Of Fame Awards 2022. Kiara Advani won the Best Actor Critic's Choice award. Kartik Aaryan and Kriti Sanon won for Best Actor Popular Choice male and female respectively. Veteran actress Rekha was honoured with the Cinematic Legend award.

124.title: B'luru city bus pass to be available online, can be booked via app
124.article_body: The passes for the Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) will be available online and can be booked via the mobile application Tummoc. All electronic payments, including QR codes, will be accepted for the purchase of passes. At present, passengers have to visit Traffic Transit Management Centres (TTMCs) and bus stations to obtain the passes.

125.title: Aus, Netherlands start legal action against Russia over MH17 downing
125.article_body: Australia and Netherlands said that they've started legal action against Russia at International Civil Aviation Organization over downing of Malaysian Airlines flight MH17 in July 2014. "Death of 298 civilians...can't...remain without consequences," Dutch Minister Wopke Hoekstra said. The Kuala Lumpur-bound plane was hit over rebel-held eastern Ukraine by what was deemed to be a Russian missile.

126.title: Police personnel in Madhya Pradesh to get leave to watch 'The Kashmir Files'
126.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Monday said he has informed the DGP to grant leave for one day to all police personnel in the state to watch Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files', whenever they choose to do so with their families. This comes after CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday declared 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free in the state.

127.title: 10 humanitarian corridors to operate today: Ukraine Deputy PM
127.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk has said that the country will try to evacuate trapped civilians through 10 humanitarian corridors that have been agreed upon for today. She added that civilians in towns near Kyiv and in eastern Luhansk will be able to use them. Earlier, Ukraine President said that 1.25 lakh people have been evacuated via humanitarian corridors.

128.title: Ukraine finish second behind China in 2022 Winter Paralympic medal count
128.article_body: Ukraine finished second in the 2022 Winter Paralympics in Beijing. Ukraine won 11 gold medals, 10 silver medals and eight bronze medals. China finished first with 18 gold medals and a total of 61 medals. Ukrainian athletes were the last delegation to arrive in Beijing because of logistical challenges caused by Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

129.title: Rishabh Pant has backed his strengths, he's learning: Jasprit Bumrah
129.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah said the team will help Rishabh Pant go forward with the tempo he likes to play at. "You can't teach everyone to play in the same manner. Pant has backed his strengths...he's [also] learning a lot and getting experience," he added. Pant smashed the fastest Test fifty by an Indian in the ongoing Sri Lanka Test.

130.title: India's wholesale inflation rises to 13.11% in February 2022
130.article_body: Wholesale inflation in India rose 828 basis points YoY from 4.83% in February 2021 to 13.11% in February 2022, as per Commerce Ministry's data. Wholesale inflation was at 12.96% in January 2022. The Ministry said high inflation in February was caused by rising prices of mineral oils, metals, crude petroleum, natural gas and food articles, among other commodities.

131.title: 'I'm done being quiet, grow the f*** up,' says Pete to Kanye; pics of chat surface
131.article_body: Screenshots of a text exchange between Kanye and Pete Davidson have surfaced in which Pete purportedly said, "I'm done being quiet. Grow the f*** up." Pete also said, "Kim (Kardashian) is the best mother I've ever met...You're so f****** lucky that she's your kids' mom." This came after Kanye claimed that his children weren't allowed to go to Sunday service.

132.title: 4 booked for entering B'luru stadium to take selfie with Virat Kohli
132.article_body: Four people, including two minors, have been booked for criminal trespassing after they ran onto the Bengaluru cricket stadium and tried taking a selfie with Virat Kohli on Sunday. They had trespassed into the playing area during a break at a match between India and Sri Lanka. The players continue to be in a bio bubble due to COVID-19 restrictions.

133.title: Virat said 'It's okay, you can fail': Harshal on 37-run joint-worst over in IPL history
133.article_body: Recalling his 37-run over against CSK last season, which is also the joint-worst over in IPL's history, RCB pacer Harshal Patel said, "Virat came up to me and said, 'You got hit...it happens. [When] you put yourself in difficult situations, you can [sometimes] fail'." Harshal added that Virat understands the "pressure situations" and has been very supportive of him.

134.title: Germany to buy F-35 fighter jets capable of carrying nuclear bombs: Report
134.article_body: Germany is planning to purchase F-35 fighter jets to replace its Tornado aircraft, according to a Reuters report quoting government sources. The country is reportedly looking to buy up to 35 stealth jets. Manufactured by US firm Lockheed Martin, the jets are capable of carrying nuclear bombs. Notably, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz recently announced an increase in defence spending.

135.title: Ex-NSE CEO Ramkrishna sent to 14-day judicial custody in co-location scam
135.article_body: A Delhi court on Monday sent former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna to 14-day judicial custody in the co-location case. Ramkrishna, who has been accused of sharing confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi', was arrested by the CBI a few days back. Earlier, CBI had demanded 14-day custody of Ramkrishna saying that she had been "evasive in her replies".

136.title: Will Smith, Jessica Chastain win best actor awards at Critics Choice Awards
136.article_body: Actor Will Smith won the Best Actor award and Jessica Chastain bagged the Best Actress award at the 2022 Critics Choice Awards on Sunday. While Smith won the award for the film 'King Richard', Chastain was awarded for her performance in 'The Eyes of Tammy Faye'. The award for Best Picture went to 'The Power of the Dog'.

137.title: Won't comment, don't want to become gossip: Jubin on dating Nikita
137.article_body: Singer Jubin Nautiyal, on being asked if he is dating actress Nikita Dutta, said that he won't like to comment as they don't want to become the subject of gossip. The two sparked dating rumours after being spotted together in Mumbai's Juhu. "Nikita and I were just hanging out at a cafe in Juhu for some time," Jubin added.

138.title: Tara to star in 'Kabir Singh' producer Murad's thriller 'Apurva': Reports
138.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria has signed on to star in 'Kabir Singh' producer Murad Khetani's women-centric film titled 'Apurva', as per reports. The upcoming thriller is expected to be a small-budget project. 'Apurva' will reportedly be directed by Nikhil Bhat, who helmed the show 'The Gone Game'. Tara will also be seen sharing screen space with Tiger Shroff in 'Heropanti 2'.

139.title: Vanced app, which blocks YouTube ads, to shut down over 'legal reasons'
139.article_body: YouTube Vanced app, which lets users block ads on YouTube without Premium subscription, is shutting down "due to legal reasons". According to The Verge, Google had sent the Vanced owners a cease and desist letter recently. "We were asked to remove all references to 'YouTube', change the logo, and remove links related to YouTube," the Vanced team told The Verge.

140.title: Don't be afraid: Sea's secretive billionaire CEO to staff on tech firm losing $150 bn value
140.article_body: Forrest Li, the 44-year-old secretive billionaire CEO of Singapore-based technology firm Sea Ltd, which owns e-commerce platform Shopee, mobile game Garena Free Fire among other businesses, wrote a 900-word memo to his employees. The memo addressed a $150-billion plunge in his company's value since late 2021. He wrote, "This drop is painful...Do not fear: We're in a strong position internally."

141.title: I'm here for all witches: Emma seemingly criticises JK Rowling at BAFTA
141.article_body: Actress Emma Watson, who presented an award at the BAFTA Awards 2022, was introduced as a witch for her Harry Potter character Hermione Granger. Emma came to the podium and stated, "I am here for all of the witches." A social media user commented, "Sly lil dig at JK Rowling there, Emma Watson?" while another wrote, "What a QUEEEEENNN."

142.title: Kashmiri Pandits' plight an outcome of Nehruvian blunders: Union Minister
142.article_body: Days after release of 'The Kashmir Files' movie, Union Minister Jitendra Singh blamed the Congress party for the plight of Kashmiri Pandits who were forced to leave the valley. "History [is] witness to the fact that all this was a cumulative outcome of a series of Congress blunders beginning from what's now recorded as infamous Nehruvian blunders," said Singh.

143.title: Snares to catch peacocks found on hills near Pune village
143.article_body: Forest department officials are monitoring the situation after people found snares to catch peacocks on hills near a village in Pune's Hinjewadi. Hunting and killing of peacocks, which is India's National Bird, is prohibited by law and carries a sentence of up to seven years in jail, an activist said. Residents have been warned about the traps, the activist added.

144.title: Delhi fountain partially closed, PWD says 'tipplers wanted to take shower'
144.article_body: The public works department in Delhi has partially closed the fountains on the stretch along the Old BRT corridor from Chirag Dilli FOB to Sheikh Sarai corridor. "Tipplers used to come during night...take selfies, sing songs and dance along the stretch...they wanted to take a shower...or wash their faces in it...they even misbehaved with security guard," a PWD official said.

145.title: iPhone supplier Foxconn halts production in China's Shenzhen amid COVID-19 curbs
145.article_body: Apple iPhone supplier Foxconn on Monday said that it has suspended operations until further notice in China's Shenzhen city after authorities imposed lockdown measures in the tech hub city amid rising COVID-19 cases. Foxconn added it would deploy backup plants to reduce the disruption to production. On Sunday, China reported over 3,000 new daily cases, its highest in two years.

146.title: Son Junaid was rejected for Mira Nair's 'A Suitable Boy': Aamir
146.article_body: Aamir Khan has revealed that his son, Junaid Khan, went for a screen test for Mira Nair's 'A Suitable Boy' but was not selected. "He never mentioned to anyone that he was my son...He made his own journey. He learnt theatre, he did plays, he got rejected from 15-20 places," Aamir added. Junaid will make his debut with YRF's 'Maharaja'.

147.title: Class 12 Chemistry paper wasn't leaked, false propaganda being spread: Maha minister
147.article_body: Maharashtra School Education Minister Varsha Eknath Gaikwad has clarified that the Class 12 Chemistry paper of state board was not leaked. Gaikwad added that "false propaganda" is being spread through social media. This comes after reports claimed the paper was leaked hours ahead of the exam. Earlier on Monday, a coaching centre's owner was arrested in Mumbai in this connection.

148.title: SA record their highest successful chase in Women's WC history, win 3 matches in a row
148.article_body: South Africa chased down a target of 236 against defending champions England to register their highest successful chase in Women's World Cup history. South Africa's previous highest successful chase in Women's World Cup had come in 2017, when they chased down a target of 207 against Pakistan. South Africa have now won three straight matches in 2022 Women's World Cup.

149.title: COVID vaccine for 12-14 age group, booster dose for everyone above 60 from Mar 16: Govt
149.article_body: Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya today announced COVID-19 vaccination of children in age group of 12 to 14 will begin from March 16. He further said that everyone aged 60-plus will now be able to get precaution doses. He wrote, "I urge the families of children and people in the age group of 60-plus that they must get the vaccine."

150.title: Tharoor shares selfie with AAP's Mann, calls it 'parliamentary camaraderie'
150.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Monday posted a selfie with Punjab CM-designate Bhagwant Mann. Sharing the picture, Tharoor wrote, "Parliamentary camaraderie...I had the pleasure of sharing his joy after five years of being seated on the same bench in the Lok Sabha in the previous term." A user commented, "This is how we want...parliamentarians across the party lines to be."

151.title: Warden of children's home in TN arrested after minor boys allege sexual abuse
151.article_body: The 36-year-old warden of a children's home in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvannamalai was arrested for allegedly sexually abusing minor boys residing at the home for past three months. Seven minor boys had reportedly called children's helpline number 1098 to report the crime. The home's owner was also arrested for neither reporting the alleged crime nor taking action against it, police said.

152.title: I gave all my time to work, forgot my family was waiting for me: Aamir Khan
152.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said that he has given all his time to his work and that he thought that his family was with him anyway. "I just wanted to win the hearts of the audience at the time. And, I got completely lost, so much so that I forgot my family was waiting for me," Aamir said.

153.title: Centre allows Sikh passengers to wear kirpan on Indian flights
153.article_body: Civil Aviation Ministry has modified an earlier order restricting Sikh passengers from wearing kirpan on flights and allowed them to do so on an "Indian aircraft within India". Kirpan's total length shouldn't exceed 22.86 cm, it said. BJP leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa shared the corrigendum's picture and thanked PM Narendra Modi and Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia for their "swift action".

154.title: Hard to digest: Pak captain Maroof on their 4th straight loss in Women's WC
154.article_body: Pakistan captain Bismah Maroof expressed disappointment after they suffered their fourth straight loss in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup. "Very hard to digest. Some bad shots from the middle-order cost us the game [against Bangladesh]," she stated. Meanwhile, Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana said she can't even describe the feeling after registering their first-ever win in Women's World Cup.

155.title: AirAsia's Bengaluru-Kolkata flight makes emergency landing in Bhubaneswar, man dies
155.article_body: An AirAsia Bengaluru-Kolkata flight made an emergency landing at Biju Patnaik International Airport in Bhubaneswar after a passenger fell ill mid-flight on Sunday morning. The airport authorities dispatched an ambulance ahead of time to transport the patient to the hospital. However, the passenger could not be saved and was declared dead at the Capital Hospital.

156.title: Unattended bag inside Delhi-bound train triggers bomb scare; bomb squad called
156.article_body: A fire was reported in a train travelling to Delhi from Haryana. An unattended bag, a pouch and a container were found inside a coach. Police said the pouch containing about 2 kilograms of nails had caught fire due to friction. A bomb disposal squad reached the spot after getting information. Police claimed the bag may belong to a carpenter.

157.title: There has been improvement in Pant's method: Irfan Pathan
157.article_body: Praising wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant, Irfan Pathan said there has been improvement in the 24-year-old's method. "Earlier, Pant used to play shots only on the leg side but now plays shots on the off-side as well...He now tries to find a way to stay on the pitch, doesn't only hit," added Irfan. Pant scored 185 runs in two Sri Lanka Tests.

158.title: Ukraine Prez meets injured soldiers in hospital, hands them medals
158.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday visited a military hospital in Kyiv to meet injured soldiers and handed them medals for their service to the country. A video of Zelenskyy interacting with the soldiers has been shared online. "Guys, get well soon. I believe that the best gift for your statement will be our common victory!" Zelenskyy said.

159.title: Nothing like that: Kartik on being asked if someone in B'wood is 'harassing' him
159.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, during his interaction with media at the Iconic Gold Awards 2022, was asked if someone in Bollywood was 'harassing' him. "There is nothing like that. Nobody is bothering me," he said. Kartik was reportedly fired from Dharma Productions' 'Dostana 2' last year due to 'unprofessional behaviour'. Kartik will be next seen in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

160.title: Pregnant Ukrainian woman whose rescue pic was shared widely dies in another Russian attack
160.article_body: A pregnant woman and her baby have died after Russia bombed the maternity hospital where she was meant to give birth. Earlier, photos of the woman being rushed to an ambulance on a stretcher were widely shared worldwide. Realising that she was losing her baby, she cried out to medics, "Kill me now!" Both she and her baby later died.

161.title: Bangladesh win a Women's World Cup match for the first time, defeat Pakistan
161.article_body: Bangladesh defeated Pakistan by nine runs to register their first-ever victory in a Women's World Cup match. Fargana Hoque top-scored as Bangladesh put up a total of 234/7. Pakistan were restricted to 225/9 despite Sidra Ameen's 104(140). Bangladesh's Fahima Khatun picked up three wickets. Pakistan have lost each of their first four 2022 Women's World Cup matches so far.

162.title: 2 boys hold poster reading 'Rohit is not my captain, reinstate Kohli', pic goes viral
162.article_body: A picture has gone viral on social media showing two boys holding a poster reading 'Rohit is not my captain, reinstate Kohli' during India-Sri Lanka Day-Night Test at M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. After facing criticism from a certain section of fans, the boys' father tweeted, "Guys relax...that was for Tests only...Rohit is no doubt 'GOAT' in white-ball cricket."

163.title: Request to wear yellow turbans, shawls for swearing-in ceremony: Mann
163.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's Bhagwant Mann, who will take oath as the Chief Minister of Punjab on March 16 requested public to reach Khatkar Kalan for the ceremony. "I request my brothers to wear yellow turbans that day and sisters to drape yellow shawls/stoles. We will colour Khatkar Kalan in 'Basanti rang' that day," he added.

164.title: 7 killed in fire at chemical plant in China
164.article_body: As many as seven people were reportedly killed after a fire broke out at a chemical plant in China on Monday. The accident occurred during some maintenance activity at Bao Gang United Steel plant in the country's Inner Mongolia region. After reaching the site, the rescue team found that seven people were missing, all of whom were later found dead.

165.title: 'Pushpa' actress Rashmika in talks for a song in Ranbir's 'Animal': Reports
165.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna, who was recently seen in 'Pushpa: The Rise', is reportedly in talks for a special song in 'Animal', an upcoming action film starring Ranbir Kapoor. It will be directed by 'Kabir Singh' fame director Sandeep Reddy Vanga and will also feature Parineeti Chopra, Bobby Deol and Anil Kapoor. 'Animal' is expected to release on August 11, 2023.

166.title: At least 596 civilians killed since Russia attacked Ukraine
166.article_body: The Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights said that at least 596 civilians including 43 children have been killed in Ukraine since Russia's attack. The number of those injured stood at 1,067 including 57 children, it added. Most of the casualties were caused by the use of explosive weapons including shelling, missiles and airstrikes, it said.

167.title: I still own & won't sell my Bitcoin, Ethereum or Doge: Elon Musk
167.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "I still own and won't sell my Bitcoin, Ethereum or Doge." However, he added, "As a general principle...It's generally better...to own physical things like a home or stock in companies you think make good products...than dollars when inflation is high." Bitcoin, Ether and Doge prices saw a brief spike after Musk's tweet.

168.title: Had Emirati wedding with Rubina in Abu Dhabi: Abhinav Shukla on 'Wanderlust'
168.article_body: Actor Abhinav Shukla, while talking about series 'Wanderlust' said that he had an Emirati wedding with his wife and actress Rubina Dilaik in Abu Dhabi. "We were dressed like the local...groom and the bride. And we were, we are a very close experience of how it would be locationally...getting married...in that style...that was memorable," Abhinav added.

169.title: ITBP official martyred, head constable injured in IED blast in Chhattisgarh
169.article_body: An official of the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) was martyred and a head constable suffered injuries when a pressure improvised explosive device (IED) planted by Naxals exploded in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur on Monday, police said. The incident took place when a team of ITBP's 53rd battalion was out on patrolling duty to ensure security to a road construction work, police added.

170.title: PM Modi is a man of tremendous vigour and dynamism: Shashi Tharoor
170.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor said PM Narendra Modi is a man of "tremendous vigour and dynamism". "The PM has done some things which are very impressive, especially politically. We didn't expect him to win with such great margins, but he did," he said. "The Indian voter has the capacity to surprise...but right now they've given BJP what they wanted," Tharoor added.

171.title: I love Jadeja's game among the new cricketers: Kapil Dev
171.article_body: Ex-India captain Kapil Dev has said he loves all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's game among the new cricketers. "Jadeja plays without pressure. He enjoys cricket. That's why he's good at bowling as well as batting. He also does a great job in fielding," stated Kapil. Jadeja smashed unbeaten 175 and picked a total of nine wickets in first Test against Sri Lanka.

172.title: 35-yr-old man charred to death after car catches fire in Bengaluru
172.article_body: A 35-year-old man was charred to death after his car accidentally caught fire on Bengaluru's NICE Road, police said. According to police, the man had pulled his car to a side and was trying to get out after he noticed the fire in the AC vent. A passerby had rushed to help the deceased when the car exploded, police added.

173.title: Taiwan's fighter jet crashes into sea; second incident in 3 months
173.article_body: A Taiwanese fighter jet crashed into the sea off its southeast coast, said the presidential office on Monday. The French-built Mirage 2000 aircraft was on a training mission from the Chihhang air base in Taitung. The pilot was reported to be safe after parachuting out of the crashing plane. In January, an F-16 jet crashed, killing the pilot.

174.title: A top industrialist asked me to sleep with his wife at my nightclub: Tehseen Poonawalla
174.article_body: Venture Capitalist and political analyst Tehseen Poonawalla, revealed in the reality show 'Lock Upp', that a top industrialist once asked him to sleep with his wife. "He booked my entire nightclub for [weekend]. His condition was that he wanted to see me sleeping with his wife." Tehseen further said that he did it as the industrialist watched.

175.title: Delhi Police personnel save 20-year-old law student who jumped into Yamuna river
175.article_body: Three Delhi Police personnel jumped into Yamuna river to save a 20-year-old law student who tried to kill himself after failing in one of his exams.
