The student belongs to Rajasthan's Alwar and studies at National Law School of India University, Bengaluru. Officials said Alwar police informed that a man will try to kill himself as he tweeted about it.

176.title: 15 arrested after several men sexually assault women in MP as onlookers recorded videos
176.article_body: As many as 15 people, including the prime accused, have been arrested after several men sexually assaulted two women on a street during the Bhagoria festival in Madhya Pradesh's Alirajpur. A video had surfaced online showing the men molesting the women one by one as onlookers recorded videos on their phones.

177.title: Maha board's Class 12 Chemistry paper leaked; coaching centre owner arrested
177.article_body: The Class 12 chemistry paper of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education has allegedly been leaked in Mumbai. Police in Vile Parle have arrested a teacher, who is the owner of a coaching centre in Malad, in connection with the paper leak. The accused allegedly shared the paper on a WhatsApp group before the exam, police said.

178.title: 6.7-magnitude earthquake hits Indonesia's Sumatra; no casualties reported
178.article_body: An earthquake of 6.7 magnitude struck Indonesia's Sumatra island on Monday prompting residents to flee homes. The epicentre was located at about 167 km from the coastal city of Pariaman, as per US Geological Survey. No loss of life or other damages were reported. The authorities initially warned of a potential tsunami but later lifted the warning.

179.title: Bees attack 200 tourists at Pune's Shivneri Fort, 25 hospitalised
179.article_body: At least 200 tourists were stung by bees at Shivneri Fort in Pune on Sunday. State forest department officials said that at least 25 tourists were hospitalised and discharged after primary treatment at a local government hospital. "Swarms of bees from at least three beehives located near the main entrance of the fort were galvanised," an official said.

180.title: Paytm shares fall to all-time low of ₹672 after RBI curbs on Paytm Payments Bank
180.article_body: The shares of Paytm fell more than 12% to hit an all-time low of ₹672 on the BSE in Monday's early deals. This comes after Reserve Bank of India (RBI) barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers until its audit is done. The stock has declined around 70% compared to its issue price of ₹2,150 per share.

181.title: It's not just attack, attack, there's a lot of method to it: Jaffer on Pant's batting
181.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said there's a lot of method to Rishabh Pant's attacking batting. "Pant comes out and attacks...he puts the (opposition) team on the back foot, and then he plays the waiting game and then surprises with his attacking shots," Jaffer explained. Pant smashed the fastest fifty by an Indian in Tests while playing against Sri Lanka.

182.title: I've absolutely no regrets: Asha Parekh on not getting married
182.article_body: Veteran actress Asha Parekh has featured on the cover of Harper's Bazaar India for its 13th-anniversary issue. The 79-year-old actress opened up about not getting married and said, "I guess I wasn't destined to get married." "Honestly, I'd have loved to get married and have children...but it wasn't meant to be...However, I've absolutely no regrets," Asha told Harper's Bazaar India.

183.title: Obama tests COVID-19 +ve, PM Modi wishes him a quick recovery
183.article_body: Former US President Barack Obama on Sunday said that he has tested positive for coronavirus, while his wife Michelle has tested negative. Following this, PM Narendra Modi extended his wishes for Obama's quick recovery and for his family's good health and wellbeing. Obama added that both he and his wife are "grateful to be vaccinated and boosted" against the virus.

184.title: 4 devotees killed, 16 hurt after truck hits tractor-trolley in Maha
184.article_body: Four people were killed and 16 others were injured after a truck hit a tractor-trolley carrying devotees on Solapur-Pune highway near Maharashtra's Kondi village, police said on Monday. The truck's driver lost control after a tyre burst, following which the incident had occurred, a police official said. The devotees were travelling to Pandharpur to celebrate 'Ekadashi', a police official added.

185.title: CPI MP gives notice to discuss slashing of interest rates on EPF
185.article_body: The Communist Party of India (CPI) Rajya Sabha MP Binoy Viswam gave a suspension of business notice under rule 267 to discuss the decision of slashing of interest rates on EPF (Employees' Provident Fund) in Rajya Sabha. "The decision of EPFO to slash interest rates will result in significant monetary losses to 60 million salaried class subscribers," the notice read.

186.title: Man handcuffs himself to door of McDonald's outlet in Russia, pic surfaces
186.article_body: A man identified as pianist Luca Zatravkin handcuffed himself to the entrance door of a McDonald's outlet in Russia after McDonald's announced it is temporarily shutting down all its restaurants in Russia amid war with Ukraine. "They don't need to shut it down. What's their reason for shutting down?" he said. He was later arrested by the police.

187.title: Treat people well at police station, offer senior citizens water: Mumbai CP
187.article_body: Sanjay Pandey, Commissioner of Police, Mumbai, told Mumbai Police personnel to treat people well at the police stations. "If we don't behave with people properly and use berating language, it will tarnish our image. If any senior citizen comes to our police station, we should offer him a glass of water," he said, adding, "Every complainant should be treated equally."

188.title: IMD issues heatwave alert in Mumbai, Thane, Raigad for next 2 days
188.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert with a warning of a heatwave in Thane, Mumbai, Raigad and north Konkan for the next two days. While the maximum temperature in Mumbai is likely to rise to 39 degrees Celsius, the minimum temperature is forecasted to rise to 24 degrees Celsius. Mumbai recorded 38.6 degrees Celsius on Sunday.

189.title: Didn't join politics to check prices of aloo, tamatar: Pakistan PM Imran Khan
189.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has said he didn't join politics to check the prices of 'aloo, tamatar', as he attacked the Opposition for tabling a no-confidence motion against him. The 69-year-old cricketer-turned-politician said that 25 years ago, he decided to join politics for the sake of the country's youth, adding that he had no personal gains from doing so.

190.title: 2 found dead in Worli, suicide suspected: Mumbai Police
190.article_body: The Mumbai Police said it has recovered two bodies, both suspected to have died by suicide in Worli on Sunday. According to the officials, one was found hanging from a tree while the other was found near Worli Sea Face. The bodies have been sent to the Nair Hospital for post-mortem, police said.

191.title: Gr Noida’s Kisan Chowk to get underpass, work to begin in 5-6 months: GNIDA
191.article_body: In order to tackle traffic congestion, the Greater Noida authority will finalise a tender to construct an underpass at Kisan Chowk in the next three months, said an official. The authority said the work is expected to begin in the next five to six months and the underpass will be ready in two years after that.

192.title: Arsenal move into top four, Chelsea defeat Newcastle in Premier League
192.article_body: Arsenal moved into Premier League's top four with a 2-0 win over Leicester City on Sunday night. Arsenal, with 51 points, have three games in hand on Manchester United, who are now placed fifth with 50 points. Meanwhile, Chelsea remain on third after their 1-0 win against Newcastle United. Manchester City are at the top with 69 points.

193.title: Russia asked for military equipment from China for its war in Ukraine: Report
193.article_body: Russia has asked China for military assistance including drones amid its ongoing war in Ukraine, a top US official cited by CNN broadcaster said. However, Liu Pengyu, the Chinese embassy spokesperson in Washington, said he was unaware of any suggestions that China might be willing to help Russia. Meanwhile, US warned China there would be consequences if it helped Russia.

194.title: 2 newly-elected councillors belonging to TMC, Cong shot dead in West Bengal
194.article_body: Two newly-elected councillors, one belonging to TMC and another to Congress, were shot dead by unidentified miscreants in separate incidents in West Bengal. While TMC blamed BJP for councillor Anupam Dutta's killing in Panihati, Congress has held TMC responsible for Congress councillor Tapan Kandu's murder in Jhalda. "Law and order [situation] is crumbling in Bengal," BJP's Suvendu Adhikari said.

195.title: Kangana once met astrologer, he said she's going to be a heroine: Prabhas
195.article_body: Actor Prabhas, during an interview about his new film 'Radhe Shyam', said that actress Kangana Ranaut had once met an astrologer who told her she's going to be a heroine. Prabhas added that Kangana felt that the astrologer was fooling her and she did not pay much attention to his prediction. Prabhas can be seen playing palmist in 'Radhe Shyam'.

196.title: BSF deputy commandant dies after fall during training in WB
196.article_body: A BSF deputy commandant died on Sunday during a physical training programme in West Bengal's Baishnabnagar, a BSF statement said. According to the statement, Ajit Singh Tanwar had complained of chest pain after he lost his balance and fell on the ground. Tanwar, who's aged 55, was taken to a hospital where he was declared brought dead, the statement added.

197.title: Man saved from falling into gap between platform, train in Mumbai's Wadala
197.article_body: An RPF constable saved a man from falling into gap between the platform and the train at Wadala station in Mumbai on Sunday. "Timely act of RPF constable Netrapal Singh, saved the life of a passenger who slipped and fell down while boarding running local train at Wadala station...Passengers are requested not to board/de-board a moving train," Central Railway tweeted.

198.title: Feels good: Jasprit Bumrah on 1st five-wicket haul on Indian soil
198.article_body: Talking about his first five-wicket haul in his fourth Test match on Indian soil, Jasprit Bumrah said it feels good to have contributed towards the team's success in the ongoing second Test against Sri Lanka. "When you play all three formats, you have to look after your body and you sometimes miss out on the home Tests," he added.

199.title: Who won what at BAFTA Film Awards 2022?
199.article_body: Jane Campion-directorial 'The Power of the Dog' was named the Best Film at BAFTA Awards 2022. Will Smith won the Best Actor award for 'King Richard' and Joanna Scanlan won the Best Actress award for 'After Love'. Ariana DeBose was named Best Supporting Actress, while Troy Kotsur won the Best Supporting Actor award. 'Dune' also clinched Best Cinematography award.

200.title: Delhi govt seeks monkey experts to check menace at Vidhan Sabha
200.article_body: In a bid to control the disturbance caused by monkeys at the Vidhan Sabha complex, the Delhi government has floated a tender seeking experts in primate psychology. "Some officials nearly got bitten… monkeys snatch food, files from employees… they jump on cars parked in the complex and damage them," said an official working at the Vidhan Sabha.

201.title: 'Avengers: Endgame', 'Body Heat' actor William Hurt passes away at 71
201.article_body: Actor William Hurt, who played Thaddeus Ross in 'Avengers: Endgame' and 'Captain America: Civil War', has passed away at the age of 71. The Academy Award-winning actor died on March 13, one week before his 72nd birthday, of natural causes, his son Will said. William was also known for his roles in 'Body Heat' and 'Kiss of the Spider Woman'.

202.title: Woman, 3-yr-old son die as motorcycle falls into canal in Haryana
202.article_body: A 27-year-old woman, Manju, and her three-year-old son, Yatin, drowned to death after motorcycle they were riding fell into canal in Haryana's Fatehabad. The woman's husband sustained injuries in the incident. Spokesperson of Fatehabad police said that passersby rescued the woman's husband. The motorcycle was also fished out from the canal. Efforts are being made to retrieve bodies of deceased.

203.title: There was no one: Aamir Khan on rumours he divorced Kiran as he was dating someone
203.article_body: Aamir Khan refuted rumours that he and Kiran Rao got divorced as he was dating someone. "Our relationship of husband and wife experienced a certain change and we wanted to respect...institution of marriage," he said. Aamir also clarified he didn’t divorce his first wife Reena Dutta because of Kiran, saying he and Kiran became friends after his divorce with Reena.

204.title: In a first, BJD forms Zilla Parishads in all 30 districts of Odisha
204.article_body: The ruling Biju Janata Dal (BJD) has become the first party to form Zilla Parishads in all 30 districts of Odisha. "This is an unprecedented victory for BJD and the result of the faith of the voters in the leadership of CM Naveen Patnaik," party leader Pinaki Misra said. He added that 70% of the Zilla Parishad Presidents are women.

205.title: Zelenskyy urges NATO for no-fly zone after Russian attack near Polish border kills 35
205.article_body: A day after 35 people were killed in a Russian missile attack on a military base near Polish border in Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged NATO to impose a no-fly zone in a video statement. "If you don't close our sky, it is only a matter of time before Russian rockets fall on your territory, on NATO territory," he said.

206.title: India reports 2,503 new COVID-19 cases, 27 deaths in 24 hours
206.article_body: India has reported 2,503 new COVID-19 cases and 27 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 3,116 cases and 47 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 36,168, while the death toll in the country reached 5,15,877.

207.title: 50-yr-old shrine vandalised, painted saffron in Madhya Pradesh; FIR lodged
207.article_body: A 50-year-old shrine located near Hoshangabad on Madhya Pradesh State Highway 22 was allegedly vandalised and painted saffron by unidentified miscreants. The shrine's caretaker alleged the wooden doors of the shrine were broken open and a hand pump inside the compound was uprooted. "We've registered an FIR, but our priority is to restore the shrine first," a police officer said.

208.title: 50 new bus routes started in Pune amid MSRTC workers' strike: Report
208.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) has started over 50 routes across and outside the district in the last two months amid the ongoing Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) workers' strike, reported Hindustan Times. A PMPML traffic manager said that the new routes have been started following demands from people in rural areas and local representatives.

209.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 4 people, recover 1.2 kg ganja from them
209.article_body: Hyderabad Police have arrested four people and have seized 1.2 kg ganja from them. Police, while sharing details of case, said that Bowenpally Police had found circumstances of seven people suspicious. Police said that the seven people tried to run away from the spot but the police chased and caught two people. Three cellphones and three bikes have been recovered.

210.title: Lady Gaga, Selena Gomez walk red carpet at Critics Choice Awards
210.article_body: Several celebrities, including Lady Gaga and Selena Gomez, walked the red carpet at the 27th annual Critics Choice Awards 2022. Gaga opted for a black-and-gold Gucci ensemble, styled by Tom Erebout and Sandra Amador. Meanwhile, Selena wore a Louis Vuitton gown at the ceremony, where she was nominated for Best Actress in Comedy Series for 'Only Murders in the Building'.

211.title: Messi, Neymar booed by own fans in 1st match after Champions League exit
211.article_body: After PSG's 2-3 aggregate loss to Real Madrid in Champions League, Neymar and Lionel Messi were booed by their own fans throughout their Ligue 1 game against Bordeaux. "I feel sad about what I saw," said coach Mauricio Pochettino. Kylian Mbappe, who was the only scorer for PSG in their Champions League tie against Madrid, was applauded in the match.

212.title: Man seeking ₹3 lakh loan cheated of ₹6.3 lakh in Pune
212.article_body: A 38-year-old man from Pune who was promised a personal loan of ₹3 lakh was allegedly cheated of ₹6.3 lakh by callers. The victim was asked to pay money in smaller amounts over nine months on the pretext of processing fees, an insurance and advance EMIs, said police, adding he was also promised an increase in loan amount.

213.title: 3 Delhi Police personnel assault traffic inspector after being asked to move car; held
213.article_body: Three Delhi Police personnel have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a traffic police inspector in Delhi's Hauz Khas area. According to police, the inspector had asked the accused to move their car as it was parked on the wrong side of the road, but the latter got angry and allegedly attacked him. Victim claimed one of the policemen slapped him.

214.title: Rickshaw driver arrested for running over pedestrian in Pune
214.article_body: A 29-year-old rickshaw driver was arrested for allegedly running over a pedestrian, a 21-year-old businessman, in Pune. According to police, the victim ignored some questions from the rickshaw driver after which the latter got enraged and ran the vehicle over him. The victim reportedly sustained a fractured hand and backbone among other injuries.

215.title: Pune MBA student cheated of ₹1L over 'work from home' job, 3 booked
215.article_body: At least three people were booked following a cheating case in which a 23-year-old MBA student in Maharashtra's Pune was defrauded of ₹1.38 lakh last year on pretext of a 'work from home' job. Police said the victim found the job on social media and was initially paid for some assignments before being asked to pay for a bigger assignment.

216.title: 2 fans take selfie with Virat Kohli after invading ground, pics go viral
216.article_body: Two fans breached security and invaded the ground while Sri Lanka's Kusal Mendis was taking treatment after being hit by a Mohammad Shami delivery in the sixth over of their second innings. The fans took a selfie with Virat Kohli before being escorted out by security personnel. The match is being held at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

217.title: Fan invades ground before being chased by around 10 officials during India-SL Test
217.article_body: A fan invaded the ground during India-Sri Lanka Test at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru during a break forced by a medical issue to Kusal Mendis. The fan was seen running towards Virat Kohli as around 10 security officials chased him. He ran towards the other side of the ground before eventually being caught.

218.title: Mumbai targets net-zero carbon emissions by 2050; 2 decades ahead of India's target
218.article_body: Mumbai has announced a Climate Action Plan to eliminate carbon emissions by 2050. Mumbai has proposed exhaustive changes to the way it manages energy, water, air, waste, green spaces and transport for its 19 million residents. Mumbai's target puts it two decades ahead of India's national goal, as the country has promised to cut its emissions to net-zero by 2070.

219.title: Confident of BJP's win in MP Assembly elections 2023: Scindia
219.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has claimed that "BJP will win" in the Madhya Pradesh Assembly elections next year. He said, "MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan is working day and night for the people's welfare and I am sure BJP will win." When asked about the Congress, Scindia said, "Congress was my past and don't want to waste time on it."

220.title: 5 Indian students aged between 21 and 24 killed in road accident in Canada
220.article_body: Five Indian students aged between 21 and 24 were killed, while two others were hospitalised after a road accident near Toronto, India's High Commissioner to Canada Ajay Bisaria said. The passenger van in which the students were travelling collided with a tractor trailer. The deceased students were identified as Harpreet Singh, Jaspinder Singh, Karanpal Singh, Mohit Chouhan and Pawan Kumar.

221.title: Woman thanks Bengaluru police for helping her escape barking dogs on road
221.article_body: A woman named Seema Khan took to Twitter to share an incident when a female inspector helped her escape "barking dogs" while Khan was returning to her hostel late at night in Bengaluru's Banaswadi. "Inspector Sheela took me to my hostel safely...I really want to share this...for girls who need any help," Khan wrote. "Very thankful," Khan captioned her post.

222.title: MoS Chandrasekhar reviews Gallium Nitride tech centre in Bengaluru
222.article_body: A press release said on Sunday that Union Minister of State for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar has visited Gallium Nitride Ecosystem Enabling Centre and Incubator facility at IISc Bengaluru. "The next two-three years [offer] a window of opportunity for Gallium Nitride to play a key role in enabling e-vehicles and wireless communication," he said after reviewing the work there.

223.title: Someone asked me 'Is Jalsa a biopic on Amitabh Bachchan's house': Vidya
223.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan said that someone asked her if her upcoming movie 'Jalsa' was a biopic on actor Amitabh Bachchan's house which goes by the same name. "I said 'you will have to wait for the answer to this question'," Vidya said, adding, "Because what do you say, how can it be the biopic of a house?"

224.title: Mumbai 1st South Asian city to announce net-zero emission roadmap
224.article_body: Maharashtra Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday announced detailed plans to make Mumbai a net-zero carbon emitter by 2050, making it the first South Asian city to do so. Putting Mumbai two decades ahead of India's national goal, the plan proposes large-scale changes in six domains. Flood-resistant drainage and investment in housing and sanitation are some of the proposed changes.

225.title: Amazon moves staff from Seattle office amid rise in violent crimes
225.article_body: Amazon is temporarily relocating employees from a downtown Seattle office amid an increase in violent crime in the area. There have been at least three shootings, two stabbings and one carjacking in the area since February 21, according to the Seattle Police Department's Twitter account. Amazon said it is providing employees currently at that location with alternative office space elsewhere.

226.title: Police recover 6 kg 'charas' worth ₹1.95 cr from peddler in Mumbai
226.article_body: Police on Sunday arrested a drug peddler from Mumbai's Dahisar area and recovered over 6 kg of 'charas' worth ₹1.95 crore in the international market. "Yesterday, we received information that a person is arriving with some narcotics substance...A court has remanded him to police custody till March 17," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (Zone 12 Mumbai) Somnath Gharge.

227.title: Govt must enrol us in colleges here: HP student back from Ukraine
227.article_body: A student from Himachal Pradesh, who returned to India from Ukraine, has sought the Central Government's intervention in helping the students complete their medical degrees in the country. Kashika Mahajan, who was a fourth-year student in Ukraine, said that students hope that the government makes special arrangements to enrol the students in medical colleges in India.

228.title: Minor among 8 booked for performing wheelies in K'taka, bikes seized
228.article_body: Eight people, including a minor, were booked for allegedly performing motorbike stunts on the streets of Karnataka's Mangaluru and the police also seized five two-wheelers. Police received multiple complaints from locals informing that the youths were performing stunts and four different cases were registered. Police found vehicles' registration numbers after monitoring social media.

229.title: Yogi will take UP to greater heights of development: PM Modi
229.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday met Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and said that he "will take the state to greater heights of development". In a tweet, PM Modi wrote, "Congratulating him (Yogi Adityanath) on the historic victory in the Uttar Pradesh elections. In the last five years, he has worked tirelessly to fulfil the aspirations of the people."

230.title: 4 arrested for looting petrol pumps in Meghalaya; gun, machete seized
230.article_body: The Meghalaya Police have arrested four people for their alleged involvement in looting petrol pumps across the state, an officer said. Police on Friday raided a hideout of the accused and recovered an AK-47 rifle, 14 live rounds of ammunition, a machete and a motorcycle, Superintendent of Police of East Jaintia Hills, Jagpal Singh Dhanoa said on Saturday.

231.title: Newborn baby stolen from govt hospital in Tamil Nadu, 2 detained
231.article_body: A man and a woman in their 30s have been detained for allegedly stealing a newborn baby from a government hospital in Tamil Nadu's Kancheepuram district. The baby's mother had reportedly gone to the washroom leaving the baby in another patient's care and found the child missing after returning. The accused pair were later caught at a bus stop.

232.title: Int'l Yoga Day to be held at 75 heritage, cultural sites this year
232.article_body: Union Ayush Minister Sarbananda Sonowal on Sunday inaugurated the Yoga Mahotsav 2022 to mark 100 days countdown to the 8th International Day of Yoga. The event will be held at 75 iconic heritage and cultural sites on International Yoga Day on June 21. "It's an opportunity to promote health, wellbeing and peace across the globe," Sonowal said in his address.

233.title: ₹2 cr to be spent on Bhagwant Mann's swearing-in as Punjab CM: Cong
233.article_body: Congress' official media platform on Sunday claimed that ₹2 crore will be spent on Bhagwant Mann's swearing-in as Punjab Chief Minister. "Bhagwant Mann is eager to empty the treasury of Punjab as soon as he arrives," the post said. Congress MLA Sukhpal Singh Khaira called it a "gross misuse of public exchequer" and said that it was "unacceptable."

234.title: 2.5 kg heroin recovered by STF in Punjab's Ludhiana, 4 arrested
234.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) Punjab on Sunday arrested four drug peddlers in Ludhiana and recovered 2.5 kilograms of heroin. Ludhiana STF in charge, Inspector Harbans Singh said that they caught the accused while they were travelling in a car near Golden Avenue on Dhandra road following a tip-off. "The accused hold a long criminal record", he added.

235.title: It'll be challenging for SL on Day 3 of Day-Night Test vs India: Vihari
235.article_body: India batter Hanuma Vihari said it'll be difficult for Sri Lanka on Day 3 of the Day-Night Test in Bengaluru after being 28/1 at stumps on Day 2, needing 419 more runs to win. "It was quite challenging [today]. A kind of wicket where any ball could get you out," he added. India declared their second innings at 303/9.

236.title: World no. 12 Lakshya loses to world no. 20 Vitidsarn in German Open final
236.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist Lakshya Sen lost to world number 20 Kunlavut Vitidsarn in the final at German Open in Mülheim an der Ruhr on Sunday. The 20-year-old Indian shuttler was beaten 21-18, 21-15 by the Thai player in 57 minutes. World number 12 Lakshya had defeated world number one and Olympic champion Viktor Axelsen in the semi-finals on Saturday.

237.title: Scindia inaugurates FlyBig Airlines' Indore-Gondia-Hyderabad flight
237.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia inaugurated FlyBig airlines' Indore-Gondia-Hyderabad flight route virtually at an event on Sunday. The services will be run under UDAN Regional Connectivity Scheme. "Indore needs to be connected with other smaller cities," Scindia said, adding, there are plans for smaller planes and helicopters to connect cities across the country "till the last mile".

238.title: Kazakhstan's Anti-Corruption Agency detains former President's nephew
238.article_body: Kazakhstan's Anti-Corruption Agency on Sunday detained former President Nursultan Nazarbayev's nephew, Kairat Satybaldy in connection to an embezzlement probe at communications firm Kazakhtelecom. Nazarbayev and many of his relatives were removed from top posts by his successor and current President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev after protests over fuel prices turned violent killing 225 people in January.

239.title: No foreign military personnel present in Maldives: Defence Ministry
239.article_body: The Maldivian Defence Ministry said on Saturday that there's no armed foreign military personnel present in the country. No foreign parties would be active at the Uthuru Thilafalhu (UTF) base, where the Maldives National Defence Force (MNDF)’s Coast Guard dock and dockyard are being developed, reports stated. This comes amid the Maldivian Opposition's 'India Out' campaign.

240.title: World beater: Jaffer on Pant scoring fastest 50 for India in Tests
240.article_body: Calling Rishabh Pant a "world beater" after he scored fastest Test fifty by an Indian against Sri Lanka in Day-Night Test, Wasim Jaffer said the frequency with which India wicketkeeper-batter produces such knocks is incredible. "Usually if a batter is mercurial he's not consistent. But in Pant we've a mercurial batter who's consistent," he added. Pant scored a 28 ball-50.

241.title: We should take lead in 6G technology: Ashwini Vaishnaw
241.article_body: Communications Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Sunday said, "[India] should take the lead in 6G technology. Otherwise, what's the point of being a nation which is...called a talent nation." "We have already initiated work on 6G also, as we have made very good progress on 4G and 5G," he added. India's 5G spectrum auction may take place in May, PTI reported.

242.title: MP man dies, wife injured after being attacked by drug addict son
242.article_body: A 50-year-old man died and his wife sustained severe injuries after being attacked by their drug addict son in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. The accused, Neeraj Kushwaha, was reportedly demanding money for drugs from his father for the last three days but was refused. On Sunday, he came home in an inebriated state and beat his parents with a stick.

243.title: Crashed drone that apparently flew from Ukraine carried a bomb: Croatia
243.article_body: A military drone that apparently flew from Ukraine and crashed in the Croatian capital, Zagreb, was carrying a bomb, Croatia's Defence Minister Mario Banožić said on Sunday. This further raises a question about whether the drone belonged to Russia or Ukraine, he added. The Soviet-era drone had flown over Romania and Hungary, both NATO-member states, before entering Croatia.

244.title: 'Bachchhan Paandey' is a fun film: Jacqueline Fernandez
244.article_body: Talking about 'Bachchhan Paandey', actress Jacqueline Fernandez said, "It's a fun film...I'm there for a cute little appearance." Jacqueline further said that she worked with actors Arshad Warsi and Kriti Sanon for the first time and added, "It was a nice experience." "With Kriti, I just had one day, but that was really a memorable one," she stated.

245.title: Actor Pulkit Samrat shares pictures from the set of 'Fukrey 3'
245.article_body: Actor Pulkit Samrat took to Instagram and shared pictures from the set of his upcoming film 'Fukrey 3'. "Fukrey 3 apki seva mein (Fukrey 3 at your service)," Pulkit captioned the post. The film is the third installation of the 2013 film 'Fukrey'. Actor Ali Fazal will reportedly not be part of 'Fukrey 3' due to scheduling issues.

246.title: China shuts tech hub over 66 COVID-19 cases, puts 17 mn people in lockdown
246.article_body: China on Sunday locked down one of its biggest cities with 17 million residents after 66 new COVID-19 infections were reported there. The southern Chinese tech hub of Shenzhen has told all its residents to stay at home to control an Omicron outbreak linked to Hong Kong. China's national cases reached a two-year high of nearly 3,400 on Sunday.

247.title: Ukrainian man learns his wife, 2 kids died after seeing their dead bodies on Twitter
247.article_body: A Ukrainian man named Serhiy Perebyinis learned about the death of his wife, and two kids, aged 18 and 9, after seeing the photos of their dead bodies on Twitter. They were killed by mortar fire last Sunday as they attempted to flee via a damaged bridge in Irpin. "I recognized their luggage," Perebyinis told The New York Times.

248.title: Russian court allows Peppa Pig piracy without punishment after Western sanctions
248.article_body: A Russian court has ruled that Peppa Pig's trademarks can be used by Russian businesses without punishment. Entertainment One, which owns the rights of the cartoon character had asked for 40,000 roubles in compensation from a Russian entrepreneur who had drawn his own version of the character. The court dismissed the case citing "unfriendly actions of US and affiliated countries."

249.title: Former Hyderabad captain Ravi Teja retires from first-class cricket
249.article_body: Former Hyderabad skipper Ravi Teja has retired from first-class cricket. The 34-year-old batter thanked his well-wishers for their constant support. Teja made his first-class debut in 2006. He represented Hyderabad and Meghalaya in domestic cricket. In his 16-year-long domestic career, Teja also represented India U-19, India A and the now-defunct IPL franchise Deccan Chargers.

250.title: Turkey & Greece leaders hold talks in rare meeting, discuss Ukraine
250.article_body: Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan held talks in Istanbul on Sunday in a rare meeting between the two countries that have been at odds over several issues. They discussed bilateral issues, as well as the Russian invasion of Ukraine, according to a statement. "Turkey and Greece have...special responsibility in the European security architecture," it added.

251.title: Malaysia reports 26,250 COVID-19 cases, 77 deaths in a day
251.article_body: Malaysian Health Ministry reported 26,250 new COVID-19 cases as of Saturday midnight taking the total caseload to over 38 lakh since the pandemic began. As per data released by the ministry, 77 deaths were recorded in the same period bringing the total death toll to 33,720. Meanwhile, out of 26,250 cases, 545 were reported to be imported cases.

252.title: Nadal beats 21-yr-old Korda in 3 sets, says 'Lucky to be through'
252.article_body: Rafael Nadal defeated world number 38 Sebastian Korda 6-2, 1-6, 7-6(7-3) in the second round at Indian Wells. After winning the match by recovering from 2-5 down in the third set, Nadal said, "I feel very lucky today to be through. Sebastian was playing some fantastic tennis." Notably, Nadal is now undefeated in all 16 matches he played this year.

253.title: Sonia Gandhi will immediately take steps to revamp party: Congress
253.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi will immediately take up corrective measures to revamp and re-strengthen the party, AICC general secretary KC Venugopal said after Congress Working Committee meeting on Sunday. Congress will hold a 'Chintan Shivir' immediately after the Budget Session of Parliament, he said, adding that the CWC will meet before that. Former PM Manmohan Singh didn't attend the meeting.

254.title: Being social media influencer helped break child actor tag: Anushka
254.article_body: Anushka Sen has said that being a social media influencer has helped her break the tag of being a child actor. "Thanks to social media that people got to know the real me, the real Anushka...I don't think people just see me as a child actor," she stated. "I didn't realise when...transition happened because I was always working," she added.

255.title: Family growing: AAP as 16 Amritsar municipal councillors join party
255.article_body: Sixteen councillors of the Amritsar Municipal Corporation have joined AAP, the party tweeted from its official account on Sunday. "AAP family is growing...After winning Assembly, AAP's flag is now waving in municipal corporations too!" the tweet read. The councillors joined in the presence of party leader Manish Sisodia, AAP's Punjab in-charge Jarnail Singh and city Mayor Karamjit Singh Rintu.

256.title: 5 people rape 22-yr-old, record the act to blackmail her in Raj
256.article_body: A 22-year-old was allegedly gang-raped by five people in Rajasthan's Ajmer, who also recorded the act to blackmail her, police said on Sunday. A case was registered at Nasirabad Sadar Police Station and Circle Officer Poonam Bhargad said the woman, a resident of Nizampura, named three of the five accused in her complaint, which was lodged on Thursday.

257.title: China to face consequences if it helps Russia evade sanctions: US
257.article_body: Speaking to CNN, US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said that China would face consequences if it helped Russia evade sweeping sanctions over the war in Ukraine. "We'll not allow...there to be a lifeline to Russia from these economic sanctions from any country," he added. Sullivan's remarks come ahead of his meeting with China's top diplomat Yang Jiechi on Monday.

258.title: 1.25 lakh evacuated via humanitarian corridors in Ukraine: Prez
258.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said that nearly 1.25 lakh people have been evacuated via humanitarian corridors from conflict zones in Ukraine so far. He described providing relief to besieged Mariupol as a "key task", with a humanitarian supply convoy 80 kilometres away from the city. Supplies in Mariupol are running low amid a Russian blockade, local officials said.

259.title: K'taka lost ₹221 cr to cybercrimes in last 3 years: State Home Minister
259.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra on Sunday said the state has lost ₹221.17 crore to cybercrimes in the last three years and only 21% of the amount has been recovered. Karnataka reported at least 32,286 cases between 2019-2022 and only 7,835 such cases have been solved. In the same period, only 75 persons have been convicted for cybercrime, Jnanendra added.

260.title: Cong lost in U'khand despite conducive environment: Ex-CM Rawat
260.article_body: Former Uttarakhand CM Harish Rawat on Sunday while taking responsibility for Congress' Assembly election defeat in the state "despite conducive environment", said the party needs to look into the reasons behind the "constant defeats". He added, "We'll work on suggestions for improvement that'll come in CWC." Congress won 19 seats in the 70-member state Assembly while BJP won 47 seats.

261.title: UK to criminalise sending unsolicited sexual pics on social media
261.article_body: The UK government has said that a law criminalising 'cyberflashing' or sending unsolicited sexual images to people through social media or dating apps, will be included in its Online Safety Bill. "Anyone who sends a photo or film of a person's genitals, for the purpose of their own sexual gratification...may face up to two years in prison," the government explained.

262.title: Every worker wants Rahul Gandhi to lead the party: Congress
262.article_body: After the Congress Working Committee (CWC) met over the party's poor performance in five states, Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala said every Congress worker wants Rahul Gandhi to lead the party. However, the new party president will be chosen at next Congress election, he added. Surjewala further said CWC wants Sonia Gandhi to guide the party till organisational elections are held.

263.title: Will always be special: Radhika on 2 years of 'Angrezi Medium'
263.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan on Sunday shared a series of stills from 'Angrezi Medium' on Instagram Stories to mark two years since its release, writing, "Will always be special". The film starred late actor Irrfan Khan. Radhika shared a picture with the late actor along with a heart emoji. The actress also shared a selfie from the first day of shoot.

264.title: He kept calling out my name in the hospital: Bappi Lahiri's son
264.article_body: Late veteran singer-composer Bappi Lahiri's son singer Bappa Lahiri has revealed that his father kept calling out his name when he was admitted to the hospital. Bappa added that he was not in India at the time and his father was supposed to visit him in the US soon. Bappi Lahiri passed away on February 15 aged 69 in Mumbai.

265.title: We know this boy: Suryakumar on Pant scoring fastest Test 50 by an Indian
265.article_body: After Rishabh Pant became the fastest half-centurion for India in Test cricket history, India batter Suryakumar Yadav tweeted, "We know this boy." The 24-year-old India wicketkeeper-batter scored a 28-ball 50 against Sri Lanka in the second and final Test in Bengaluru, breaking Kapil Dev's 40-year-old record. In 1982, Kapil had scored a fifty from 30 deliveries against Pakistan.

266.title: Congress will form 'aapki sarkar' in Haryana: Ex-CM Hooda
266.article_body: Former Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda, while addressing Congress workers on Sunday, said the party will form "aapki sarkar (your government)" in the state. He added, "Somebody will say...AAP...formed a government in Punjab. That's AAP party...not aapki (your) government." He also called to throw out the incumbent BJP-JJP government, saying, "Nobody can stop you if you stand united with me."

267.title: 24-year-old woman pilot flew back 800 Indian students amid Ukraine war
267.article_body: A 24-year-old pilot named Mahasweta Chakraborty flew 800 Indian students back to safety amid the Ukraine war. The Kolkata native reportedly flew six evacuation flights, four from Poland and two from Hungary, between February 27 and March 7. "I salute [the students'] fighting spirit and am extremely proud of having played my part in their journey back home," said Chakraborty.

268.title: Could have responded but observed restraint: Pak PM after India misfires missile
268.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Sunday said that they could have responded to India after its missile landed in their country but they "observed restraint". On March 9, an unarmed Indian missile landed in Pakistan, to which the former said that it was an "accidental firing". Later, Pakistan called for a joint probe "to establish the facts surrounding the incident."

269.title: India beat Germany 3-0 in a shootout at Women's Pro Hockey League
269.article_body: India beat Germany 3-0 in a shootout in second match of their two-legged tie as both teams were tied at 1-1 after 60-minute regulation time at FIH Women's Pro Hockey League in Bhubaneswar on Sunday. India had lost first match 1-2 in a shootout on Saturday. World number nine India secured two points from the match, including a bonus point.

270.title: Russia to ban Instagram tonight, users told to move their pics and videos
270.article_body: Russia has notified Instagram users in the country that the service will cease from midnight on Sunday, advising them to move their photos and videos from Instagram. Russians are being encouraged to switch to Russia's own "competitive internet platforms". This comes after Instagram parent Meta said it'd allow Ukraine users to post messages such as "Death to the Russian invaders".

271.title: 14 wickets fall on Day 2 as SL need 419 more runs to win D-N Test, India need 9 wickets
271.article_body: Sri Lanka ended the second day of the Day-Night Test in Bengaluru at 28/1 in their second innings, needing 419 more runs to win, while India need nine wickets to win. Earlier in the day, India declared their second innings at 303/9, setting Sri Lanka a target of 447. As many as 14 wickets fell on the second day.

272.title: 4 terrorists arrested in MP's Bhopal, were preparing sleeper cell
272.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Anti-Terrorism Squad arrested four suspected terrorists in Bhopal on Sunday and seized laptops and religious literature from their possession. They have been said to have links with banned outfit Jamat-e-Mujahideen Bangladesh, a government statement said. They were preparing a sleeper cell to conduct anti-national activities in the future, the statement added.

273.title: Getting eyeballs has been toughest, 'SOTY 2' changed things: Aditya
273.article_body: Actor Aditya Seal said "getting eyeballs" for his work has been the toughest for him in the industry. Aditya added that his films like 'Tum Bin 2' did not succeed because of many reasons like demonetisation. "Things changed with the release of 'Student Of The Year 2' (SOTY 2), it did manage to get people into the cinemas," he stated.

274.title: 179 Jharkhand students stranded in Ukraine return to state
274.article_body: As many as 179 students from Jharkhand who were stranded in Ukraine have returned to the state, officials confirmed on Sunday. Students from districts of Ranchi, East Singhbhum, Dhanbad, Godda, Palamu, Hazaribag and Bokaro, are among the evacuees. On February 25, the Jharkhand government had set up a control room to help families of those stuck in Ukraine.

275.title: Russia using phosphorus bombs that Nazis called 'flaming onion': Ukraine
275.article_body: Russian forces have been accused of using illegal phosphorus weapons in Ukraine. Oleksi Biloshytsky, the head of police in Popasna, around 100 kilometres west of Luhansk city, said that the Russian forces had used the chemical weapon in his area. "It's what Nazis called a 'flaming onion' and that's what Russcists (amalgamation of 'Russians' and 'fascists') are dropping," Biloshytsky added.

276.title: Last reserves of food and water are running out: Ukraine's Mariupol
276.article_body: The City Council of Ukraine's Mariupol on Sunday said that the last reserves of food and water are running out amid a Russian blockade. "There is no electricity, water or heating in the city. There is almost no mobile communication," it claimed. The council also said that Russian forces blockading the city continued to shell non-military targets.

277.title: I don't think about being best tennis player: Nadal on his 16-0 in 2022
277.article_body: Asked if he considers himself the "best tennis player" at present since he defeated world number one Daniil Medvedev twice recently, Rafael Nadal said he doesn't think about that and doesn't care much. "I don't put myself in that- 'I want to be...best,'" he added. The 21-time Grand Slam champion is 16-0 this season, having won three titles so far.

278.title: AirSerbia to reduce flights to Moscow post criticism from EU, Ukraine
278.article_body: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic on Saturday said country's airline, AirSerbia will return to operating one flight a day to Moscow after "the witch hunt" against his country. This comes after EU, Ukraine criticised the Balkan nation and said that AirSerbia is profiting from the Russia-Ukraine war. Since Russia invaded Ukraine, AirSerbia had doubled the number of flights to Moscow.

279.title: His determination is an example for WI: Kraigg on Bonner's 9-hour 123 vs Eng
279.article_body: Following the drawn first West Indies-England Test, West Indies skipper Kraigg Brathwaite praised teammate Nkrumah Bonner, saying his determination is an example for the team. "He's special...has a special mindset," he added. Notably, Bonner's first innings score of 123 runs from 355 balls spanned more than nine hours, which helped his side lead England by 64 runs after first innings.

280.title: Sonia Gandhi to continue as Congress chief, CWC decides after 4.5-hr meeting
280.article_body: Days after its poll debacle in five states, Congress Working Committee on Sunday decided that Sonia Gandhi will continue as the party president. The meeting, which lasted for four-and-half-hours, was attended by Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra,  Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge and P Chidambaram, among others. "We all have faith in her leadership," said Kharge.

281.title: France to offer 4th COVID-19 vaccine dose to all above 80 from Monday
281.article_body: French Prime Minister Jean Castex said government will start offering fourth COVID-19 vaccine doses for all above 80 years of age from Monday, March 14, reported Le Parisien. During an interview with the daily, Castex said the vaccination drive will be extended to those with an immunocompromised system. This comes as France is set to relax COVID-19 restrictions from Monday.

282.title: Pet hamsters can trasmit COVID-19 to humans: Hong Kong study
282.article_body: Hong Kong researchers said pet hamsters can pass COVID-19 to humans and that they were most likely responsible for city's Delta variant outbreak. As per study, 50% from the tested Syrian hamsters in a pet shop and 58% from a warehouse in Hong Kong were tested positive for COVID-19. Team added both locations were ascertained as prime sources of transmission.

283.title: Cooperative sector to contribute hugely in $5 trillion economy goal: Amit Shah
283.article_body: Cooperation Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said the cooperative sector is going to make the largest contribution to PM Narendra Modi's aim of making India a $5 trillion economy. He said a strong cooperative sector will also help realise the dream of Aatmanirbhar Bharat. He added that the cooperative sector will benefit several crore people associated with it.

284.title: After Haryana & Gujarat, MP makes 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free
284.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government on Sunday declared Anupam Kher starrer 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free in the state. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "[The film] is a heart-wrenching narration of the pain, suffering, struggle and trauma faced by Kashmiri Hindus in the 90s." The governments of Haryana and Gujarat have already declared the film tax-free.

285.title: Who's a Russian oligarch & why are oligarchs being sanctioned by the West?
285.article_body: An oligarch is a member of a small group with power. In the context of Russian politics, the term was first used to describe some powerful men who amassed immense wealth following the collapse of the USSR. By sanctioning Russian oligarchs, the US and its allies hope that the elite class might pressure President Vladimir Putin to end the war.

286.title: I contested for the 1st time: AAP MLA who defeated Ex-Punjab CM Channi
286.article_body: AAP MLA Labh Singh Ugoke, who defeated Congress' Charanjit Singh Channi from Bhadaur seat, said he contested the Assembly polls for the first time. "It's a new type of politics in which a labourer's son can become MLA. I'll work to improve condition of hospitals and improve quality of education," he added. Ugoke defeated Channi by 37,558 votes.

287.title: Mamata can't run WB peacefully, how can she govern India: Vijayvargiya
287.article_body: BJP's Kailash Vijayvargiya dismissed West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee as potential PM candidate for 2024 Lok Sabha polls, stating that there's no alternative to PM Narendra Modi. "Mamata...is not able to run her own state peacefully, how can...[she]...run [India]," he added. Banerjee had earlier said that BJP's victory in Assembly polls of four states isn't true reflection of people's mandate.

288.title: Iran claims missile attack near US consulate in Iraq's Irbil
288.article_body: Iran on Sunday claimed responsibility for a dozen ballistic missiles that struck near the US consulate in Iraq's Irbil. The attack targeted the Israeli "strategic centre of conspiracy" in the city, it said. It was in retaliation for an Israeli strike in Syria that killed two members of its Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, Iran added.

289.title: Gujarat Titans launch their first jersey at Narendra Modi Stadium, share pic
289.article_body: Gujarat Titans, who'll make their debut in IPL 2022, launched their first-ever jersey at Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad ahead of the tournament. Gujarat Titans' Director of Cricket Vikram Solanki, head coach Ashish Nehra, captain Hardik Pandya and BCCI Secretary Jay Shah attended the launch. Gujarat Titans will face Lucknow Super Giants in their IPL 2022 opener on March 28.

290.title: Harry Styles texted stranger 'Love you' thinking it's me: Rosalía
290.article_body: Singer-songwriter Rosalía has revealed that singer Harry Styles once texted her old number which then belonged to a stranger to compliment her song 'Dolerme'. The stranger replied with 'Love you' to which Harry responded with 'Love you too', Rosalía said. She added that the stranger then messaged Harry, "This number [belonged] to someone else before...Don't bother me anymore. Good night."

291.title: Hearing incredible things: Akshay to Anupam on 'The Kashmir Files'
291.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar on Sunday appreciated veteran actor Anupam Kher's performance in 'The Kashmir Files', tweeting, "Hearing absolutely incredible things." Akshay further wrote that he hopes to watch the film soon, adding that it is amazing to see the audience back to the cinemas in large numbers. 'The Kashmir Files' depicts the mass exodus of Kashmiri Pandits from the state.

292.title: Talks with Taliban on operating Kabul airport underway: Turkey
292.article_body: Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu on Sunday said talks with Taliban on operating Kabul's Hamid Karzai International Airport are still underway. Çavuşoğlu added he is willing to operate the airport with Qatar only if its security demands are met. This comes a day after he met acting Foreign Minister of Afghanistan Amir Khan Muttaqi in southern Turkey.

293.title: Sucking my stomach in since I was 11, wanted no concealing: Jamie on look for new film
293.article_body: Actress Jamie Lee Curtis shared her look from her new film 'Everything Everywhere All at Once', and wrote on Instagram, "My instruction to everybody was: I want no concealing of anything." She said, "I've been sucking my stomach in since I was 11." The 63-year-old actress added, "I...decided to relinquish and release every muscle...that I used to clench."

294.title: Sanctions against Russia will not resolve Ukraine conflict: Turkey
294.article_body: Imposing sanctions on Russia will not resolve the ongoing Ukraine crisis, Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu has said. Çavuşoğlu added that he had discussed the situation in Ukraine with EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell Fontelles at the Antalya Diplomacy Forum. Turkey had previously reiterated that it will not join Western sanctions against Russia.

295.title: I get the feedback that I'm good-looking, it's bizarre: Dino on not getting roles
295.article_body: Model and actor Dino Morea said that people in Bollywood never saw him 'beyond his looks' and that was one of the reasons he was passed up for roles. "I just get the feedback that 'you are good looking'. I find it very bizarre...Being good looking sometimes works against you in Bollywood," said Morea.

296.title: Theatres opened after 2 yrs & 'Gangubai...' rocked box office: Vidya
296.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan in an interview has stated it is amazing that theatres have opened after two years and a female led-film has rocked the box office. "Look at what is happening with 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'," the actress added. Vidya further said that female characters are being portrayed as individuals now rather than as "the perfect, ideal woman".

297.title: Actor Sean Penn tests +ve for COVID after coming back from Ukraine
297.article_body: Actor Sean Penn, who recently returned from Ukraine, has tested positive for COVID-19. As per media reports, director Paul Thomas Anderson said the actor had tested positive for COVID-19 while receiving an award at the 2022 Directors Guild of America Awards, which was to be presented by Sean. Sean was in Ukraine to shoot a documentary on the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

298.title: Was being bit of b***h: Campion on Elliott's 'The Power...' criticism
298.article_body: Filmmaker Jane Campion has reacted to actor Sam Elliott's criticism of her film 'The Power of the Dog' and said, "He was being a little bit of a b***h." "It's really unfortunate...because he's really hit the trifecta of misogyny...xenophobia and homophobia," Campion stated. This comes after Elliott had called Campion's film "a piece of s**t" on a podcast.

299.title: We wanted to win vs England, but happy with draw: WI batter Bonner
299.article_body: West Indies batter Nkrumah Bonner said his side expected to win against England in the first Test, however, added they're happy with the draw. "We showed real character the way we bowled...have a lot of positives to take out of this game," he added. Bonner scored 123 runs in the first innings and unbeaten 38 runs in the second innings.

300.title: Earth-forming meteorites may have formed in outer solar system: Study
300.article_body: Japanese researchers suggested that meteorites that helped form Earth may have formed in the outer solar system. Team revealed that these asteroidal materials may have been transported in inner solar system by chaotic mixing during early turbulent phase of solar system. As per study, surface minerals of these outer-belt asteroids may have sourced building blocks of Earth's water and life.

301.title: All parties must exercise restraint over Ukraine: Qatar minister
301.article_body: Qatar's Foreign Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al-Thani on Sunday called on all parties to exercise restraint and avoid further escalation over situation in Ukraine. In a phone call with his Ukrainian counterpart, Dmytro Kuleba, Al-Thani urged all to resolve disputes through constructive dialogue and diplomatic methods. This comes as the minister will reportedly visit Moscow on Sunday.

302.title: Ex-Union Minister Uma Bharti throws a stone in liquor shop in MP, shares video
302.article_body: Former Union Minister Uma Bharti on Sunday tweeted a video wherein she could be seen throwing a stone in a liquor store in Madhya Pradesh. The former minister, who has been advocating for a liquor ban in the state, tweeted that the shop is located in a workers' settlement and she has warned the authorities to close the store.

303.title: Karisma shares pic with Madhuri, fans say Dil To Pagal Hai 2
303.article_body: Actress Karisma Kapoor on Sunday took to Instagram to share a picture with actress Madhuri Dixit, writing, "Look who I bumped into at the studio, my all-time fav MDji." Madhuri and Karisma had appeared together in the 1997 film 'Dil To Pagal Hai' which also starred Shah Rukh Khan. Several fans wrote in the comments, "Dil To Pagal Hai 2'."

304.title: Big commercial entertainers won't ever go out of style: Kriti Sanon
304.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon in an interview has stated that big commercial entertainers won't ever go out of style, adding that they will keep getting made. "There is a lineup of films, all blockbuster potential, waiting to come," the actress added. Kriti further said that this is a healthy time for actors as many bilingual and trilingual films are being made.

305.title: Sri Lankan govt to hold all-party conference amid economic crisis
305.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has called for an all-party conference on March 23 over the current economic situation in the country, according to local media reports. Sri Lanka's economic crisis began due to the pandemic, leading to a decline in the country's foreign exchange reserves. The crisis has also led to a shortage of essential items in the country.

306.title: We talk about Dhoni being Mr cool but Rohit is cool as cucumber: Irfan
306.article_body: Comparing Rohit Sharma and MS Dhoni, Irfan Pathan said everyone talks about Dhoni being Mr cool but India captain is "cool as a cucumber". He added, "Rohit was given...role of opening the innings [in 2013 Champions Trophy]...that took his career to another level." Irfan further said Rohit changed MI when he replaced Ricky Ponting as captain midway in IPL 2013.

307.title: LIC reports ₹235 crore net profit in Q3 ahead of IPO
307.article_body: IPO-bound LIC's net profit rose from ₹94 lakh in Q3 FY21 to ₹234.9 crore in Q3 FY22 while its net profit between April-December 2021 rose to ₹1,643 crore from ₹7 crore reported last year. First year premiums during Q3 rose 10% YoY to ₹8,748 crore. LIC will offload 31.62 crore shares in the upcoming IPO, its draft papers said.

308.title: Harvard student launches website for Ukrainian refugees after 3 sleepless nights
308.article_body: Avi Schiffmann, a 19-year-old neurophilosophy student at Harvard University, launched the website 'Ukraine Take Shelter' with his friend Marco Burstein to help Ukrainian refugees to find temporary places to stay. It connects Ukrainian refugees with potential hosts and housing from around the world. "We didn't sleep for three days, we got it (website) up as fast as possible," Schiffmann said.

309.title: How has Virat Kohli's batting average changed after every Test?
309.article_body: Virat Kohli's Test average dropped below 50 today for the first time after more than four years. Kohli's batting average crossed 40 for the first time after his 10th Test. His average was 48.03 after 50th Test, while it hit 50 for the first time after 52nd match. Kohli achieved his highest batting average of 55.10 after his 81st Test.

310.title: Sanctions have frozen almost $300 bn of Russia's gold, forex reserves
310.article_body: Sanctions imposed on Russia have frozen around $300 billion of $640 billion that Russia had in its gold and forex reserves, Russian Finance Minister Anton Siluanov said on Sunday. He added that the West was also pressuring China to limit its trade with Russia. Siluanov said Russia will pay roubles to its debt holders until reserves are unfrozen, RIA reported.

311.title: Looking at humanitarian use of sanctioned properties of Russians: UK
311.article_body: British Housing Minister Michael Gove on Sunday said that the UK is looking at whether it can use properties owned by sanctioned individuals in the country for humanitarian purposes. Gove made the comment when asked if the homes of sanctioned oligarchs could be used to house Ukrainian refugees. "We are not talking about permanent confiscation," he added.

312.title: Iran suspends talks with rival Saudi Arabia: Report
312.article_body: Iran has temporarily suspended direct talks with its regional rival Saudi Arabia, Iranian state-linked media reported on Sunday. Notably, the announcement comes a day after Saudi Arabia executed 81 people convicted of crimes ranging from killings to ties to militant groups. The talks began last year and are aimed at defusing tensions between the two countries.

313.title: Fake 'KBC' offering ₹25 lakh prize money busted by Mumbai policeman
313.article_body: A 25-year-old police constable attached to Mumbai's Cyber Police at BKC busted an online fake version of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati', which was allegedly offering a prize of ₹25 lakh to the winner. Vijay Jadhav discovered that the voice and image of Amitabh Bachchan were being used to lure people into depositing money to participate in the online lottery.

314.title: 51-yr-old US journalist shot dead by Russian forces in Ukraine: Ukraine police
314.article_body: A former New York Times journalist was shot dead and another injured by Russian forces in Ukraine, said Ukraine's police. The US journalist was identified as 51-year-old Brent Renaud. The New York Times while confirming Brent's death said "Though...contributed to The Times in the past (most recently in 2015) he wasn't on an assignment for...The Times in Ukraine."

315.title: Meta acquired interesting things, it isn't innovative: Gaming veteran Fils-Aimé
315.article_body: Gaming industry veteran Reggie Fils-Aimé said Facebook parent Meta itself is "not an innovative company". He told Bloomberg, "They have either acquired interesting things like Oculus and Instagram, or they've been a fast follower of people's ideas." Fils-Aimé, the former President of Nintendo of America, said the digital future will be driven by smaller companies that are really innovating.

316.title: Putin suffering from 'roid rage' possibly from cancer treatment, claim spies
316.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin is suffering from "roid rage" possibly from a steroid treatment for cancer, reports said quoting intelligence sources. Senior figures in the Five Eyes intelligence alliance said Putin's "increasingly erratic behaviour", "bloated face and neck" and his "absurd" social distancing with visitors could be potential side effects of prolonged use of steroids.

317.title: Want to become voice of Goa: AAP leader after winning Benaulim seat
317.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Capt. Venzy Viegas, who won from Benaulim constituency in recently-concluded Goa Assembly polls, said on Sunday that he wishes to become the voice of the state. "The politics of change has begun," he added. Viegas defeated former Goa CM and Trinamool Congress (TMC) candidate Churchill Alemao in the election by a margin of 1,271 votes.

318.title: Parking curbs near B'luru cricket stadium for India-Sri Lanka match
318.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police have issued an advisory for parking of vehicles near the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in view of the India-Sri Lanka match till March 16. Parking along CTI Circle (Cubbon Road) to Dickenson Road, on both sides, is completely banned in this period. However, alternative parking arrangements have been made.

319.title: Didn't expect Ronaldo to score hat-trick vs Spurs: Man Utd's Rangnick
319.article_body: After a 3-2 win over Tottenham Hotspur, Manchester United manager Ralf Rangnick said he did not expect Cristiano Ronaldo to score a hat-trick in the match. "His training session on Thursday was so good...I decided to play him from the start and not have him on the bench," Rangnick said. "In the end, it was the right decision," he added.

320.title: Ex-Pak batter Zaheer Abbas inducted into the PCB Hall of Fame
320.article_body: Ex-Pakistan batter Zaheer Abbas was inducted into the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Hall of Fame on Saturday. Abbas scored 5,062 runs in 78 Tests and 2,572 runs in the 62 ODIs. He scored 108 centuries in his first-class career. Abbas is the third cricketer to be inducted into the PCB Hall of Fame after Fazal Mahmood and Wasim Akram.

321.title: Hope to finish 33.2 km of Pune Metro's Phase-I by Dec-end: Maha Metro
321.article_body: The Maha Metro, the implementing agency for the Pune Metro project, aims at completing 33.2 kilometre of Phase-I by the end of December. It will first focus on completing the stretch from Phugewadi to Shivajinagar. "The good response to Pune Metro rail has put public pressure on us to complete the work," a metro official said.

322.title: 3,00,000 people currently in COVID-19 isolation or quarantine in Hong Kong
322.article_body: About 3,00,000 people in Hong Kong are in COVID-19 isolation or under home quarantine, Hong Kong's Chief Executive Carrie Lam said. Lam said the estimate for quarantined people could be overstated as the isolation period for fully vaccinated individuals was reduced to one week from two last month. Hong Kong officials confirmed over 32,000 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday.

323.title: How will I get work if people keep recommending their friends in B'wood?: Zareen
323.article_body: Actress Zareen Khan, who made her Bollywood debut in 2010 in 'Veer', said, "How will people like me get work if people keep recommending their friends in Bollywood?" She added, "Since I didn't make much effort to become friends with people from the business...I lacked opportunities." She also said, "The major trend right now is that everybody is everybody's friend."

324.title: Virat Kohli's Test average drops below 50 for 1st time after 40 matches and 4 years
324.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli's Test average has dropped below 50 for the first time after 40 matches and over four years. This comes after Kohli was dismissed for 23 and 13 runs in the ongoing Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka, which is his 101st Test. Kohli's average stayed above 50 consecutively from his 61st Test 100th Test match.

325.title: 21-yr-old DU graduate dies by suicide at rented house in Delhi
325.article_body: A 21-year-old Delhi University graduate, Prakhar Yadav died by suicide at his rented accommodation in Delhi's Vijay Nagar area, police said on Sunday. The deceased's body was recovered after his neighbours informed a police head constable about him on Friday evening. According to his roommate Monu Bharti, Yadav had been working in Noida since last week, a police officer said.

326.title: Thailand lays out buffet for elephants as it marks 'Elephant Day'
326.article_body: A buffet was laid out for nearly 60 elephants in Thailand's eastern Chonburi province on Sunday as country marked its annual 'Elephant Day'. Elephants were treated to two tonnes of fruits and vegetables laid out on an eight-metre-wide table at venue. Elephants are a source of national pride for Thailand and are used for labour and transport, among other purposes.

327.title: Narendra Bansode appointed senior VP of Pimpri Chinchwad Congress
327.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad City District Congress Committee has appointed Narendra Bansode as its Senior Vice President. President Kailas Kadam handed the letter over to Bansode at the party's office in the presence of Secretary of All India Congress Committee Prithviraj Sathe. "Congress party's egalitarian ideology has been ingrained in my mind since my childhood," Bansode said.

328.title: Marks on Japanese monkey’s tooth may question human evolution: Study
328.article_body: Scientists from New Zealand, Japan said unusual toothpick-like marks on teeth of wild  Japanese monkeys may have significant implications on human evolution. As per the study, the grooves which were found in ancient human fossils were evidence of use of tools. However, the scientists said Japanese monkeys have not been seen using tools suggesting reassessment of cultural habits in humans.

329.title: Vehicle movement banned on B'luru's Goraguntepalya flyover at night
329.article_body: A ban has been imposed on the movement of vehicles on Bengaluru's Goraguntepalya flyover between midnight and 5 am. Police said the decision was taken as it becomes difficult for them to distinguish between light and heavy vehicles during the night. An expert panel from the Indian Institute of Science had termed the flyover unsafe.

330.title: I was there, police were in awe of his humility: Innov8 founder on Paytm CEO's arrest
330.article_body: Amid reports of Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma being arrested for alleged rash driving in February, the founder of Innov8 has come forward as a witness. Dr Ritesh Malik tweeted, "There was no arrest, no negligent driving...the car didn't even have a scratch. I was there and saw...how he managed the situation was fantastic...Police were in awe of his humility."

331.title: I personally felt that fifty was like a century: Shreyas Iyer on his viral celebration
331.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer opened about his viral celebration following his fifty against Sri Lanka in first innings of the Day-Night Test. "I personally felt that fifty was like a century. That's why I celebrated like that. It was like a century feeling for me," he said. Iyer raised his bat with one hand and helmet with another to celebrate.

332.title: Tharoor shares number of Opp'n MLAs, says 'this is why Congress is worth reviving'
332.article_body: Shashi Tharoor on Sunday shared number of MLAs of BJP versus Opposition parties across India, showing Congress with the highest number of lawmakers (753) among Opposition parties. "This is why Congress remains by far the most credible of the national opposition parties. It's also why it's worth reforming and reviving," said Tharoor. A crucial Congress Working Committee meeting is underway.

333.title: Women entrepreneurs display sustainable products at expo in Hyd
333.article_body: Sustainable products, including leaf tableware and vegan coffees, were displayed at 'The Business Women Expo 2022', which is being held in Hyderabad. "We want to address...[use of] single-use plastic, so we took this initiative (leaf tableware)...It [also] gives antioxidants to food," an entrepreneur said describing her product. Expo was inaugurated by TRS leader Kavitha Kalvakuntla on Friday.

334.title: Gurugram authorities plan to launch on-street paid parking in city
334.article_body: The Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority (GMDA) plans to launch a pilot project of on-street paid parking in the city in an effort to resolve the parking woes, officials said. The pilot project will run until multi-level parking facilities are constructed in the city to ease traffic congestion, they added. The GMDA has identified 17 spots for on-street parking.

335.title: Nearly 4 lakh Ukrainians fled to Romania since Russia invaded: Report
335.article_body: Police officials at Ukraine-Romania border on Sunday said a total of 3,97,542 Ukrainians have escaped to Romania since Russian invasion on February 24. As per UN International Organization of Migration (IOM), more than 25 lakh civilians have escaped from Ukraine so far. On the other hand, Russian Defence Ministry said their forces are targeting Ukrainian military and not civilians.

336.title: 1 dead as bus carrying Ukrainians refugees crashes in Italy
336.article_body: A bus carrying about 50 Ukrainian refugees crashed on a highway in Italy on Sunday, leaving one dead and several others injured, the fire service said. The passengers were taken to a nearby police barracks for initial assistance, and would later resume their journey, according to Italy's Interior Ministry. The bus was heading towards Italy's Pescara from Ukraine, it said.

337.title: S Korea records over 3.5 lakh new daily cases for 2nd day in a row
337.article_body: South Korean health authorities on Sunday said the country reported 3,50,190 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours, down from 3,83,651 cases from the previous day. As per Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency (KDCA), 251 deaths were reported in the same period. Meanwhile, South Korean Foreign Ministry extended its advisory against overseas travel till April 13.

338.title: US proposes plan to cut smog pollution from power plants, industries
338.article_body: US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) on Friday proposed stringent rules to control and lessen interstate smog pollution from power plants and industries. Named 'Good Neighbour', the plan would aim to cut about 29% emissions of smog-forming nitrogen oxides from power plants by 2026. The agency added that the measures will also target a 15% reduction from other industrial sources.

339.title: Rishabh Pant smashes fastest fifty by an Indian in Test cricket history off 28 balls
339.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant has set the record for smashing the fastest fifty by an Indian in Test cricket history, achieving the feat off 28 deliveries against Sri Lanka in the Day-Night Test in Bengaluru. The previous record was held by former India captain Kapil Dev, who had taken 30 balls to score a fifty against Pakistan in 1982.

340.title: Russia threatened Google exec in 2021 to remove anti-Putin app in 24hrs: Report
340.article_body: Russian agents threatened Google's top executive last year to remove an app designed to help register protest votes against President Vladimir Putin within 24 hours, or risk going to prison, The Washington Post reported. Google reportedly moved the executive to a hotel but the agents showed up at her room. As per the Post, Google removed the app next morning.

341.title: Adani, Piramal among 14 firms looking to buy Anil Ambani's Reliance Capital: Report
341.article_body: Adani Finserve, KKR, Piramal Finance and Poonawalla Finance are among the 14 prominent firms that have expressed interest in buying debt-ridden Reliance Capital promoted by Anil Ambani's Reliance Group, PTI reported on Sunday. The last date for submission of bids for the firm was extended to March 25. Last year, RBI superseded Reliance Capital's board in view of payment defaults.

342.title: How could you say no to this?: Rishad Premji on US author's letter to Monroe
342.article_body: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji tweeted a letter written by Nobel Prize-winning US author John Steinbeck, to actress Marilyn Monroe in 1955, asking her for an autographed photo for his nephew-in-law. "He's already your slave...This would make him mine...If you'll do this, I'll like you very much," Steinbeck wrote. Premji tweeted, "How could you say no to a letter like this?"

343.title: Video shows ITBP personnel playing kabaddi in snow-clad Himalayas
343.article_body: The ITBP has shared a video on Twitter showing its personnel playing kabaddi in the high Himalayas in Himachal Pradesh. In the 38-second video, ITBP personnel can be seen dressed in their snow gear. "Full of josh, playing in snow...Himveers of Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) playing Kabaddi," the caption of the video read.

344.title: Govt can float LIC IPO without fresh filing till May 12: Reports
344.article_body: The government has time till May 12 to float the LIC IPO without filing fresh papers with SEBI, PTI reported. If the deadline is missed, the government will have to file fresh papers with Q3 FY22 results and an updated embedded value. "We're watching the volatility and will file the red herring prospectus giving price band soon," an official said.

345.title: Russian missile attack at Ukraine military base kills 35, injures 134 others
345.article_body: A Russian missile attack on a Ukrainian military facility near the border with NATO member Poland killed at least 35 people while injuring 134 others on Sunday, reported Reuters while quoting regional governor Maksym Kozytskyi. Ukraine's Defence Minister while confirming the incident said, "Foreign instructors work here…This is a new terrorist attack on peace & security near the EU-NATO border."

346.title: Pune policemen, hawala agent rob businessman of ₹45 lakh, arrested
346.article_body: Thane Police have arrested three Pune policemen for allegedly robbing a businessman of ₹45 lakh, with the help of a hawala agent, who is a relative of the complainant. Upon learning that the businessman was transporting ₹5 crore hawala cash, the agent informed the policemen, who stopped the businessman in Bhiwandi and allegedly took ₹45 lakh, police said.

347.title: Punjab got honest CM in so many years: Kejriwal in Amritsar roadshow
347.article_body: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM-elect Bhagwant Mann held a mega roadshow in Amritsar on Sunday to celebrate AAP's victory in the Punjab Assembly polls. "For the first time after so many years, Punjab has now got an honest Chief Minister," Kejriwal said. He added that now all the money will be spent on Punjab and its people.

348.title: India relocates embassy to Poland due to attacks in western Ukraine
348.article_body: India has decided to temporarily relocate its embassy in Ukraine to Poland "in view of the rapidly deteriorating security situation in Ukraine", the Ministry of External Affairs said on Sunday. This was being done due to Russian attacks in the western parts of Ukraine, it added. The situation will be reassessed in the future, the government said.
