349.title: I've done films where my heart didn't belong, but respect it: Yami
349.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has stated that she has done certain films even when she was aware that it wasn't something where her heart belongs. She further said that she respects the people who gave her the opportunities, adding that it was still work at the end of the day. "I've evolved a lot as a professional...Opportunities are different," Yami said.

350.title: RCB had bid for Du Plessis with captaincy in mind: Mike Hesson
350.article_body: Revealing why RCB appointed Faf du Plessis as their skipper over others, Director of Cricket Mike Hesson said the franchise had bid for ex-South Africa skipper in IPL mega auction 2022 with captaincy in mind. He explained that RCB wanted to expand on their leadership group with Glenn Maxwell and Virat Kohli being retained due to their huge captaincy experience.

351.title: You've succeeded outside the system: Hansal to 'The Kashmir...' maker Vivek
351.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta on Sunday tweeted, "Congratulations Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri for 'The Kashmir Files'." "You've succeeded outside the system, on your own terms. Ideologically or otherwise I might disagree with your views and films but as a colleague, I must commend you," he added. The film, which was released on Friday, has earned ₹12.05 crore in India so far.

352.title: BCCI ask players to follow NCA's fitness plans during IPL: Report
352.article_body: To ensure optimum fitness ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 and Cricket World Cup 2023, BCCI have reportedly directed players to stick to their fitness plans during IPL as well. The decision has been taken after BCCI reportedly learnt that players used to avoid their NCA-made fitness plans during the IPL and followed ones given by their respective franchises.

353.title: We found ourselves in tricky spots, but didn't panic: Root on 1st WI Test
353.article_body: Talking about their first Test against West Indies, which ended in a draw, England captain Joe Root said he's really proud of the players for their performance in the game. "From that first hour, we found ourselves in tricky spots...Throughout the game, we got better and better...Leach was great...Zak showed a huge amount of character to stand up," stated Root.

354.title: Post victory BJP unmasks by cutting EPF interest: Mamata Banerjee
354.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the BJP-led Centre for slashing the interest rate on the Employees Provident Fund deposits. "After victory in UP, BJP comes out with its gift card immediately! It at once unmasks itself by proposing to slash the interest rate on EPF deposits to a four-decade low nadir," CM Banerjee tweeted.

355.title: Have trouble sitting idle, sitting quietly for 5 mins feels like waste of time: Nooyi
355.article_body: Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi at the Jaipur Literature Festival 2022 spoke about what motivated her. She said, "When I sit quietly, I feel I have wasted five minutes of my time. I'm constantly thinking about how to change the world or to help somebody...I have trouble sitting idle. That's why meditation has never been a part of my life."

356.title: Vicky wishes 'Uri' director Aditya Dhar on b'day, shares pic from set
356.article_body: Vicky Kaushal took to Instagram to wish 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' director Aditya Dhar on his birthday. He shared a picture from the set of the 2019 action drama and wrote, "Happy birthday mere Bhai. Lots of love!" Responding to his post, Aditya wrote, "Love you!!" Vicky and Aditya have teamed up for another film titled, 'The Immortal Ashwatthama'.

357.title: She tries to do more than she has to: WV Raman on Smriti's 123 in WC
357.article_body: Talking about Smriti Mandhana's 119-ball 123 against West Indies in 2022 Women's World Cup, ex-India Women head coach WV Raman said the India opener always tries to surpass herself. "She tries to do more than she has to but here she didn't get into that mode...she was calm," he stated. "It was a fabulous innings," he further said.

358.title: Jagdev's membership was cancelled over 3 months ago: BJD MP Misra
358.article_body: Biju Janata Dal (BJD) has denied links with MLA Prashant Jagdev who's accused of ramming his car into a crowd that injured 22 people in Khordha, Odisha. BJD MP Pinaki Misra said, "BJD membership of Jagdev was cancelled more than three months ago after his suspension by party president Naveen Patnaik." He assured that "law will take its own course".

359.title: Valuables worth ₹29 lakh stolen from Mumbai jeweller's home, 5 held
359.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested five people following a robbery at a jeweller's house in which gold ornaments and cash worth ₹29.60 lakh were looted. Those arrested include the jeweller's estranged brother who allegedly masterminded the burglary. According to police, three armed men had barged into the house on March 10 and threatened the jeweller's family members before fleeing with valuables.

360.title: Gurugram civic body demolishes 40 shanties in 2-day drive
360.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) has demolished 40 shanties in Sector 40, Sector 54, Sector 56, and Sector 57 during a two-day drive last week, officials said. Around two acres of prime civic land were recovered during the drive, officials said. There was no major resistance from the locals during the drive, they added.

361.title: I'd pay to watch him bowl: Irfan on Bumrah's 8th 5-wicket Test haul vs SL
361.article_body: Praising Jasprit Bumrah for his eighth five-wicket Test haul against Sri Lanka in second Test, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan tweeted, "I would pay to watch Bumrah bowl. What a bowler!" The India pacer, who registered bowling figures of 10-4-24-5, dismissed Niroshan Dickwella (21) for his fifth wicket. Notably, the Sri Lankan wicketkeeper-batter's wicket was Bumrah's 300th international wicket.

362.title: 21-yr-old Indian fighting Russian forces in Ukraine willing to return to India: Report
362.article_body: R Sainikhesh, a 21-year-old aerospace engineering student from Tamil Nadu who joined the Ukrainian paramilitary force as a volunteer to fight the Russian forces, has reportedly expressed his willingness to return to his home in Coimbatore. Sainikhesh's father spoke to him three days ago, during which Sainikhesh had expressed his willingness to return home, PTI reported quoting his family sources.

363.title: UK to offer support for probe on Russian 'war crimes' in Ukraine
363.article_body: UK Deputy PM Dominic Raab will visit International Criminal Court in The Hague on Monday to offer support for probing alleged war crimes by Russia in Ukraine, UK government said. "Russian commanders carrying out war crimes should know they can't act with impunity," Raab said. Raab will also meet ambassadors from other countries to build coalition focused on aiding investigation.

364.title: Gujarat gets new sports policy, to set up 4 new High Performance Centres
364.article_body: The Gujarat government has unveiled its sports policy (2022-27) in which the state will get four new High Performance Centre (HPCs) for elite athletes out of which one will be exclusively for para-athletes. The policy also promises to set up a sports goods manufacturing cluster in the state and encourages private sector participation in setting up HPCs and others.

365.title: Unification of MCDs needed as Delhi govt blocking funds: Gambhir
365.article_body: BJP MP Gautam Gambhir has said that the unification of municipal corporations of Delhi (MCDs) has been necessitated due to state government's blocking of funds given by the Centre for the civic bodies. Notably, the announcement of dates for municipal polls in Delhi was postponed following a communication from the Centre to State Election Commission on unification of civic bodies.

366.title: Dhoni was completely opposite of what I thought captaincy would've looked like: Faf du Plessis
366.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis said that MS Dhoni was the complete opposite of what he thought captaincy would've looked like. "I came to...CSK...and I was like 'This guy is completely different than I thought what it should be'," he added. "What it taught me was...there were different styles, but it's important that you...have your own style," he stated.

367.title: Andhra boy lives with mother's body for 4 days thinking she's asleep; goes to school daily
367.article_body: A 10-year-old boy in Andhra Pradesh stayed with his mother's dead body for four days, thinking she was sleeping. He went to school every day by dressing up himself, ate snacks at home and slept beside his mother. The incident was reported after the boy called his uncle to inform him about a foul smell emanating from his mother's body.

368.title: Ambedkar musical at JLN Stadium to go on till March 24: Delhi govt
368.article_body: The musical on the life of BR Ambedkar will go on till March 24 at Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium, Delhi, after receiving a "tremendous response" from the public, Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's office said. The script of the musical comprises social commentary on the plight of the Dalit community. The musical was scheduled to end on March 12 earlier.

369.title: Man arrested for raping 2 minor daughters in Maharashtra's Palghar
369.article_body: A 45-year-old man was arrested in Maharashtra's Palghar district on Sunday for allegedly raping his two minor daughters, currently aged six and 12, repeatedly since 2019 after their mother's death, police said. A complaint was registered after the victims approached an NGO. The victims told police that he would point a knife and threaten to kill them whenever they resisted.

370.title: Shimron Hetmyer sports pink hair as he joins RR for IPL 2022, franchise shares pic
370.article_body: Shimron Hetmyer has sported pink hair as he joined Rajasthan Royals for IPL 2022. The franchise shared a picture of Hetmyer joining the team and wrote, "Love is in the hair...Welcome home!" "West Indians bring a very spicy flair to IPL," a fan commented. Hetmyer was bought by RR for ₹8.5 crore in the IPL mega auction.

371.title: Gandhi family important for Congress' unity: Rajasthan CM Gehlot
371.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Sunday said that the Gandhi family is important for Congress' unity. He added that Rahul Gandhi should once again become the party chief. On the party's recent loss in Punjab polls, Gehlot said, "It was our mistake that due to internal conflict we lost the assembly elections in Punjab."

372.title: Ranbir-Alia's new house to have a room dedicated to Rishi Kapoor: Report
372.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's new house in Mumbai will reportedly have a special room dedicated to his late father Rishi Kapoor. The Kapoor family has preserved each and every memory of the late actor, including a bookshelf, his favourite chair, and other things, the report quoted a source as saying. All these things will be kept in the room.

373.title: Was nice to rebuild with Beth Mooney: Ellyse Perry on win vs NZ
373.article_body: Following a 141-run win against New Zealand Women in the Women's ODI World Cup, Australia Women all-rounder Ellyse Perry said it was nice to rebuild the innings with batter Beth Mooney. Australia Women were down to 56/3, however, Perry, Mooney, Tahlia McGrath and Ashleigh Gardner powered Australia to 269 runs. In reply, New Zealand were bowled out on 128 runs.

374.title: Poor batting performance from us: NZ captain Devine on loss vs Aus
374.article_body: After a 141-run defeat against Australia Women in the Women's ODI World Cup, New Zealand captain Sophie Devine said that her side put up a poor batting performance in the match. In reply to Australia's 269 runs, New Zealand Women were bowled out on 128 runs. "The way Australians set it up (with the bat), that's the blueprint," Devine added.

375.title: Don't see Marvel going from Hugh to me: Daniel on rumours of playing Wolverine
375.article_body: Actor Daniel Radcliffe, responding to rumours of portraying the character of Wolverine, stated that he doesn't see Marvel going from actor Hugh Jackman to him. The actor added, "But who knows? Prove me wrong, Marvel." Daniel further said that people have been congratulating him on the news about playing Wolverine but he doesn't know anything about it.

376.title: Terrific decision by RCB to appoint Du Plessis as captain: Gavaskar
376.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that Royal Challengers Bangalore took a terrific decision by appointing Faf du Plessis as their captain for IPL 2022. "Loads of captaincy experience, loads of leadership quality you see in Du Plessis. I am not surprised at all," Gavaskar stated. Du Plessis was bought by RCB for ₹7 crore in IPL 2022 mega auction.

377.title: Why is letter 'Z' being used by Russians to show support to the war in Ukraine?
377.article_body: The letter 'Z' is being used by Russian politicians, influencers and others to show support to President Vladimir Putin's actions in Ukraine. Russian Defence Ministry explained that the 'Z' represents a number of slogans that begin with the Russian word for 'for' (Za), like 'For Victory' or 'For Peace'. The symbol has also earlier been used to intimidate government critics.

378.title: 5 members of family killed, 1 injured as car hits culvert in Andhra Pradesh
378.article_body: Five members of a family, including a six-month-old baby, died and another person was injured after the car they were travelling in lost control and crashed into a culvert in Andhra Pradesh's Krishna district on Sunday, police said. The deceased, all residents of HUDA colony in Hyderabad, were on their way to West Godavari district to attend a family function.

379.title: I won't mind if people call me 'Baahubali' star forever: Prabhas
379.article_body: Actor Prabhas has said that he won't mind if people call him a 'Baahubali' star for the rest of his life. "'Baahubali' gave me so many things...The issue is the expectations set after 'Baahubali'," the actor added. Prabhas further said that there is definitely some kind of pressure after being recognised in the whole country and not just one state.

380.title: Mumbai BJP workers burn copies of police notice sent to Fadnavis
380.article_body: The BJP workers in Mumbai on Sunday protested against a police notice sent to former CM Devendra Fadnavis in connection with the alleged illegal tapping of phones. They also burnt copies of the police notice. Several BJP leaders gathered outside Fadnavis's home in south Mumbai where a cyber police team reached to record his statement in this case.

381.title: Dollar-denominated debt is bad idea, exposes one to Fed's moods: Zoho CEO
381.article_body: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu has said that dollar-denominated debt is a bad idea. "They leave companies and the country exposed to the Fed's (the US' Federal Reserve) mood swings," he explained. Vembu was commenting on a Twitter thread by Human Rights Foundation's Alex Gladstein. "The fiat/petrodollar system can be considered a form of neocolonialism," Gladstein wrote in the tweet.

382.title: Faced ups & downs on my own: Zareen on being called 'Salman Khan actress'
382.article_body: Actress Zareen Khan, who made her debut in 2010 with Salman Khan-starrer film 'Veer', spoke about being tagged as a 'Salman Khan actress' and said that she'll forever be grateful to him for making her a part of the industry. "But that's about it...I've faced the ups and downs on my own and I've dealt with my struggles," she added.

383.title: Kohli needs to play as much as possible with full face of bat: Gavaskar
383.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's form, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the 33-year-old needs to try and eliminate the shots that are getting him out. "That shot he played [during India's first innings in ongoing Bengaluru Test] wasn't the shot he should have played. [Kohli needs to] play as much as possible with the full face of the bat," stated Gavaskar.

384.title: Union Minister's sons booked for linking Sharad Pawar to Dawood Ibrahim
384.article_body: Union Minister Narayan Rane's sons, Nitesh and Nilesh, have been booked for accusing NCP supremo Sharad Pawar of having links with the fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim. The complaint was filed by NCP leader Suraj Chavan, Mumbai Police said. Earlier on Saturday, Chavan had questioned Nilesh's demand for the resignation of state Minority Development Minister Nawab Malik.

385.title: BJP propagated Cong as a Muslim party: Rajasthan CM
385.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister and Congress leader Ashok Gehlot on Sunday said BJP propagated Congress "as a Muslim party on social media". "During polls, religion comes to the forefront while issues of inflation and jobs take a back seat for BJP," he added. We lost the Assembly elections in Punjab due to internal conflict, Gehlot said.

386.title: Forced to change our statement by police: Wife of deceased tribal
386.article_body: After Manuram Nureti was killed in a 'police encounter' in Bastar, his wife Manvati wrote to Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel alleging that they were being "forced to change their statement" in favour of the police. The police had labelled the 26-year-old a 'Maoist' but later retracted their own claim stating that he was "a normal villager...killed in a crossfire".

387.title: Delhi railway reservation services to be inactive on Sunday late night
387.article_body: The Delhi Passenger Reservation System (PRS) will remain inactive for about 3.5 hours between 11:45 pm on March 13 and 3:15 am on March 14, said Indian Railways on Sunday. The services such as reservation of tickets, cancellations, internet booking, charting, PRS enquiry on 139 will not be accessible to the public during this time.

388.title: Female representation in Indian judiciary 'abysmal': Justice Banerjee
388.article_body: Justice Indira Banerjee said the representation of women in the Indian judiciary has been "abysmal" since independence. "Delhi High Court has seven women judges, out of a total of 45. Calcutta High Court has five women judges, out of 39 judges," she said. Only 11.8% of incumbent high court judges are women, said Chief Justice of India NV Ramana.

389.title: Wedding procession attacked in UP for playing song praising PM Modi, CM Yogi
389.article_body: The members of a wedding procession were allegedly beaten up and their vehicles were vandalised by unidentified miscreants in Uttar Pradesh's Auraiya for playing an election-themed song praising PM Narendra Modi and CM Yogi Adityanath. The accused allegedly escaped with cash worth ₹2 lakh and jewellery. Police said a case has been registered and search is underway to trace attackers.

390.title: Notice B'wood's silence on 'The Kashmir Files', their time is up: Kangana
390.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Sunday appreciated Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' on social media, adding that there's pin-drop silence in Bollywood about it. She also appreciated the film for breaking myths about bringing audiences to theatres. Kangana further wrote, "Bullydawood aur unke chamche sadme mein chale gaye hain (Bollywood bullies and their cronies are in shock)...Their time is upp!"

391.title: Anupam Kher starrer 'The Kashmir Files' declared tax-free in Gujarat
391.article_body: The Gujarat government has declared 'The Kashmir Files', starring actor Anupam Kher, as tax-free in the state. The film's maker Vivek Agnihotri thanked Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel. Earlier, Haryana had announced the tax-free status for the film and asked cinemas and multiplexes to not charge state GST on the movie.

392.title: Delhi's Class 9, 11 students to be promoted as per 2020-21 policy
392.article_body: Delhi's Class 9 and 11 students will be promoted based on the promotion policy of 2020-21, the Delhi Directorate of Education said. All government, government-aided and private schools are required to follow the policy. Results of Classes 9 and 11 will be calculated for promotion with passing criteria of 33% in each of the five subjects students are studying.

393.title: Organisational failure to blame for UP poll defeat: Shivpal Yadav
393.article_body: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party (Lohia) chief Shivpal Singh Yadav said on Sunday that while the atmosphere was conducive for party to win in UP Assembly elections, it suffered from organisational failure. Yadav, whose party had allied with Samajwadi Party (SP) for polls, added that they welcome people's mandate and will work towards strengthening the organisation. SP won 111 seats in polls.

394.title: Actress Rupaa Dutta held for pickpocketing at fair; kept a diary of her theft record
394.article_body: Bengali actress Rupaa Dutta, who had once wrongly accused Anurag Kashyap of sending her inappropriate messages, has been arrested for allegedly pickpocketing at a Kolkata book fair. The police found ₹65,760 from her bag and a diary in which she had maintained an account of her stealing. Rupaa admitted that she was picking the pocket at the crowded fair.

395.title: NIA arrests 6 people for trafficking Rohingya Muslims into India
395.article_body: The NIA arrested six people who were allegedly part of a syndicate involved in the illegal trafficking of Rohingya Muslims into Indian territory, an official said. The network was operating in the border areas of West Bengal, Assam and Meghalaya as well as other parts of the country, the official added.

396.title: Make all efforts to bring back mortal remains of Indian student who died in Ukraine: PM
396.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday chaired a meeting of the Cabinet Committee on Security to review India's security preparedness and the prevailing global scenario in the context of the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. During the meeting, PM Modi directed that all possible efforts should be made to bring back the mortal remains of Naveen Shekharappa, who died in Ukraine.

397.title: Kyiv is always beautiful, even during war: Zelenskyy's advisors in video from Kyiv
397.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's close advisors recently shared a video from the country's capital, Kyiv, on social media. In a tweet, Mykhailo Podolyak, an Advisor to the Head of the President's Office, wrote, "Kyiv is always beautiful. Even during wartime." A correspondent also quoted them as saying, "It's a shame the city is so empty but we did find coffee!"

398.title: Naomi Osaka breaks down after woman in crowd says 'You suck', video surfaces
398.article_body: Naomi Osaka broke down in the post-match interview after her defeat against Veronika Kudermetova in round of 64 of Indian Wells Masters. Earlier, a woman in the crowd shouted, "Naomi, you suck." Osaka said being heckled didn't bother her, but an old video of Serena Williams and Venus Williams being heckled at the same tournament replayed in her mind.

399.title: I find things chilly, I'm thin: World's largest air-conditioning firm Daikin's CEO
399.article_body: Masanori Togawa, the 73-year-old CEO of the world's largest air-conditioning company Daikin, while speaking about his personal air-conditioning usage, said, "I tend to find things chilly; I'm thin and don't have enough muscle!" He told Bloomberg, "But we're based in Osaka, which is brutally hot during the summer. There's no way we can survive there without air conditioning."

400.title: People in UP feel it's their own govt, not of some particular community: Piyush Goyal
400.article_body: Following BJP’s victory in four states including UP, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said that people in UP now feel that it is their "own" government and not the government of a particular community. Commenting on BJP’s performance in Punjab, Goyal stated that the BJP has increased its influence in the state significantly.
